Small but enough equipment and hardly anyone there.

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Hotel Downtown Seattle”
Reviews.Author: hurstdj
Reviews.Content: On a recent cruise my fiance and I took out of Seattle to Alaska we decided to go a few days early and see Seattle. We wanted a 4 star hotel down town Seattle. A four star hotel isn't cheap, so the rates I found were no surprize. I took a chance on Travelocity blind hotel deal for $100/night. We got the Pan Pacfic, downtown, within walking distance of the space needle, Pikes market, in the middle of down town. We loved this place. The decor was modern very up to date. And with the SeaStar restaurant next door what could be better. A must have is the Seastar Appetizer Tower, as the young people say OMG. Diner for two will be appox. $100 plus, but well worth it. So if you ever get the opprotunity to stay down town Seattle choose the Pan Pacfific you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with a Wholefood's attached”
Reviews.Author: Lulusmum
Reviews.Content: Just returned from two separate stays at this hotel and it was fine. Rooms are a decent size but if you want a balcony, you don't get much of a view and if you want a view - you don't get the balcony. I believe the more expensive rooms may provide both. The 'glass' bathrooms are an odd feature unless you are an exhibitionist or want the neighbours in the apartments surrounding the hotel to have a good laugh when you're in the shower or on the loo. The room cleaning was always late and we had to ring up on two occasions to get it done - and this was at 4pm each time. It has free internet access and a good work area in the room. Bed very comfy and they provide free own-bottled water. The key feature for us was that Wholefoods was underneath the hotel so breakfast there was cheap and good and we also took advantage of the takeaway. The gin and tonic in the bar was the best of the holiday. Staff on reception are prone to mood swings; some days friendly/some days not quite.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accommodating, a bit expensive”
Reviews.Author: ljwilkin
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed in a King-sized corner room at Pan Pacific recently and were very happy with our experience. The staff is very accommodating - they happily met every request we made and were prepared with restaurant suggestions and directions. The only downside to the Pan Pacific is the price - it's a bit expensive so we were only able to enjoy the hotel for one evening. Also, the traffic is a bit noisy at night, but us certainly not bad. We definitely plan on returning... once we have some extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but beware of....”
Reviews.Author: RonS412
Reviews.Content: This new and modern hotel is in a great location, very clean and quiet. Consider it a downtown hotel but just far enough away from the congestion and noise of downtown. Close to everything. The queen room we had was small, considering the price they charge. The mattress was hard; we could feel the springs!. Rip-off for parking is $40/night, but plenty of free overnight parking (til 8am M-Sat.) on the street. First run movies in your room will cost $20! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: DDK2011
Reviews.Content: We booked three rooms and stayed in this hotel for two days before our Alaska cruise. We thought it would be a little far from the downtown. But it turned out it is not too far. We (my 81 year old father, and 5 year old daughter) were able to walk to Pine Place Market. The hotel has a free town car (big enough to hold all of us). We used it a couple times and not much wait each time. The room was very comfortable with a big bathroom. The service was excellent. Our flight back home was late at night after the cruise. The hotel stored our luggage for us during that day and we used their town car to take us to where we wanted to go. There is a fitness center across the street, and it was very nice facility. The whole food market downstairs was very convenient to get a snack any time we want. We would go back next time if we travel to Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Beautiful room and awesome service”
Reviews.Author: jorge2cr
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Pan Pacific Seattle last week. The rooms are great, the 4 piece bathrooms are huge. The beds are very comfortable. Having a Starbucks connected to the hotel lobby is a nice feature. The service from all staff (front desk, valet and housekeeping) is fantastic and friendly. The hotel is not in the heart of the downtown area but you can easily get to all the cool spots within a short walk. Pan Pacific Seattle will be my hotel of choice when going to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Pure luxury and great customer service . . . couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: nrenee14
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to a handful of luxury hotels over the past year and the Pan Pacific - hands down - has provided us the best experience. The front desk staff were extremely warm, our room was beautiful, and the location was perfect for our evening in Seattle. On our way to the hotel we got a little lost (I wrote down the wrong address) and had to call the hotel for directions to the property. The young woman at the desk was extremely helpful and patiently directed us to the hotel. We had a long day of traveling and just wanted to be done with driving for the rest of the day so we had the valet take our car and rolled our luggage into the hotel lobby. I'm sure we looked a mess (we had been in the car for around 6 hours and spent a lot of time sitting on the Seattle freeways) but the staff was all smiles and made us feel welcomed. Our room was spacious, immaculate, and had a very modern design. We had a separate shower and spa tub, and a wonderful view of space needle. The hotel shares a plaza with a spa, Starbucks, Whole Foods, and other shops. We decided that night to walk downstairs that evening and grab a few goodies from Whole Foods for an in-room dinner. It was the perfect romantic getaway and definitely a place that we'd not only return to but recommend to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful environment”
Reviews.Author: jmaryz
Reviews.Content: We chose Pan Pacific because of the online reviews and we weren't disappointed. The room was big and the bathroom was also big with a huge tub. Our view was ok (there was a lot of crane activity on the buildings nearby that was interesting) and if we looked in the corner of the window we could see the space needle. Great to have Whole Foods downstairs. Parking in the garage was expensive but if you can get a spot on the street, it's free on Saturdays and Sundays. No need for a car if you're going to just stay in the city as it's very walkable. Passed up on the Seastar as the menu looked uninspired. Went to SPUR instead and it was fantastic. The Pan Pacific was clean, quiet and the staff were very helpful. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience all around!”
Reviews.Author: Lori L
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel very much, attentive staff, clean and nice size room, great location and great food at restaurants for breakfast and dinner! We would definately return at our next stay in Seattle. Highly reccomend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite in the premier league”
Reviews.Author: divisaderoguy
Reviews.Content: As urban hotels go, this is functional enough. Room decor is safe and bland. Beds comfortable. Baths are spacious but the sliding window over the tub opening to the bedroom creates some awkward sight lines as w.c. is not walled off as in many hotels these days. While the manager claimed the hotel had the fastest wi-fi in Seattle, our connection was fitful throughout a three-day weekend and not up to video, which has become my litmus test for in-room broadband these days. TV has some overly complicated remote controls on the interactive menu and it's hard to navigate the movie and other entertainment choices. Retail outlets in same complex as hotel are a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Ronda B
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Clean, well-designed rooms. Convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Girls Trip!!”
Reviews.Author: LaliBird
Reviews.Content: 8 friends went to Seattle and Portland. We stayed at the Pan Pacific and it was perfect. Because we wanted 2 beds we were on separate floors, but that was not an issue as we were either out or all together in one room. The hotel has a courtesy car that took us to the Market and picked us up. The doormen and valets were extremely nice and helpful. Starbucks is next door one way and Whole Foods the other. The rooms were very quiet and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Clean, Value”
Reviews.Author: jchef12
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just 1 night as my wife and I spent a night out on the town. I was apprehensive at first because the hotel is not exactly in the center of town, but the price was much better than the other options available. Turns out the walk from the waterfront wasn't bad at all, infact we enjoyed it. The hotel is new, and it shows. Very clean and modern feel to it. We were greeted by a friendly staff. The bath tub is a plus, it's a good size and overlooks the bedroom....nice touch. My only complaint was the size of the room, it was small. Other than that I was very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all of our expectations, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Ride188
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Pan Pacific. Our check in in took about 2 minutes, what a relief from the protracted checks in we've experienced. The room was beautiful with a full view of the Space Needle and Lake Union. The bed was the best hotel bed we've ever experienced. My wife is trying to track down their sheets to purchase a set. We thoroughly enjoyed the location, and proximity to Sea Star, Whole Foods, and downtown. The staff was cheerful and patient with my many questions. Great location, great food, knowledgeable staff, all in all a fine stay. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pre Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: dr__dawggy
Reviews.Content: Three couples, my wife and I, her sister and her husband and their parents, stayed here for three nights before embarking on an Alaskan Cruise. Each of us had a different size room....ours was the smallest but was perfectly adequate for our needs....My inlaws had a much larger corner room with a view of the Space Needle in one direction and water views in the other. They were upgraded to this room when we mentioned it was their 65th Anniversary.....We booked through Kayak, which was offering a low weekend rate that applied to two of the three nights of our stay....so we got to take advantage of a five star hotel for a three star price. We used the courtesy limo to take us to nearby attractions, such as the Space Needle This is a great service since the hotel is not in the middle of the action. The Whole Foods store downstairs became our regular spot for two meals per day...fresh food, decent prices and a seemingly endless variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: NumberEleven11
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great service and location. We stayed during a 5 day family vacation in Seattle -- we thought the hotel was great. We stayed in a Balcony Studio Suite which was roomy for the four of us with the pull out sofa and an added cot. The location was really good right between downtown and South Lake Union - everything we wanted to access was easily walkable. South Lake Union (SLU) is a great new (redeveloped) area between downtown and Lake Union. Lots of good restaurants around the corner. With a family, the Whole Foods, Starbucks, and Pizza Restaurant right below the hotel were very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect girl's weekend with a view”
Reviews.Author: kiwishell1970
Reviews.Content: Great location, beautiful view of the space needle from our window and the staff couldn't have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Decent value - accommodating staff”
Reviews.Author: MG21800
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with my wife and son. We were first put in a room that was too small and not what we thought we had reserved. We told the front desk about our dissatisfaction. They said they were nearly full but did manage to move us to a larger room. Rooms were clean and nicely decorated. Large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more, just okay”
Reviews.Author: baby888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights, we had 2 adjoining rooms. Quick and friendly check-in, friendly valet, nice lobby. Rooms were nice, very spacious bathroom in both rooms. Ordered room service for 5, fries on 4 of the orders were stone cold, ordered bread & butter which we did not receive. Caesar salad was made with very unfresh lettuce. Called about the fries being cold, and request that replacement fries be sent up, which we did receive. Was not really pleased at all with the meal. Ordered room service again the next night, also requested bread for 6, was charged $12 for 6 pieces of bread!! No soda machines in the hotel, went to Whole Foods downstairs, no regular pop is sold there, only "organic" pop (nothing to do with the hotel, just a heads up if you are a pop drinker). After staying at a hotel, you should have the feeling that you can't wait to come back and that you want to tell everyone what a wonderful stay it is. This hotel in my opinion is just okay, I would not return here. We will continue to stay at the Hyatt at Olive 8 where we usually stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ritzcarltongirl
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at the Pan Pacific in a Space Needle view room and would definitely return. It is a beautiful hotel, really nice comfortable rooms, big bathroom with separate shower and decorated beautifully. The staff is friendly and helpful. They even have a car service that will take you anyway in a 2 mile radius in the morning and evenings. The hotel is located walking distance from the lake, Space Needle, and the downtown restaurants and shopping. As a bonus, the hotel sits on top of Whole Foods where they serve the best breakfasts ever! Also, attached to the hotel is Starbucks. I am a princess when it comes to traveling and hotels and this hotel definitely met my princess standards!

Reviews.Title: “Almost -- but not Quite -- Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Leesee61
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I planned a short trip to Seattle for this past weekend and we wanted to stay someplace nice, someplace centrally located, and someplace that would be easy to get to via a major highway exit. The Pan Pacific met our needs quite well, though we encountered a few snags in terms of our room. We booked a lake view queen room, which ended up being a construction-site-with-the-lake-in-the-far-background-view room, but the room itself was very nice -- except for said snags. Herewith, I will attempt to describe for you the pluses and minuses of our stay this weekend. The cons: (1) One of the light sockets was not working, which posed a problem for me because I travel with a CPap machine and I needed an outlet near the bed. The front desk promised to send someone up to look at the problem and offered an extension cord in the meantime. I don't know if they ever sent someone up to look at the socket but the socket remained "dead" our entire stay, so while this particular snag was not a biggie, it was not fixed either. (2) The cordless phone next to the bed was virtually impossible to use. (3) Some of the promised little extras, such as a corkscrew, and a cubby in the mini fridge for storing food or drink items we purchased were missing from the room. (4) We requested a wakeup call the day of our departure, but did not receive one. The pros: (1) The hotel is in a great location, close to a trolley stop, good restaurants, and above a Whole Foods. (2) Our room was very clean and smelled fresh. (3) Our bathroom was large and spa-like, with a wonderful soaking tub. (4) The bed and the rollaway cot were both very comfortable. (5) We got a pretty decent rate for our stay. All in all and taking all of the above into consideration, while our stay at the Pan Pacific was not perfect, it came pretty close, and I feel good about recommending this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: ValuingTraveler
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel. Relatively new, in an area that is seeing considerable redevelopment off the main drag of downtown Seattle. The hotel itself is an oasis â€“ the architectural and styling lines ooze creature comfort. Check in is flawless, with no limit on the amount of information conveyed in a helpful, welcoming way. Even booking through Expedia, at a reduced advance rate, we were given a 10th floor Lake view room. The room boasts almost floor to ceiling windows from post to post. The amount of natural light is stunning, even on two gloomy days in Seattle. The bathroom is set off by sliding doors, which when opened convey and reinforce a sense of roominess. The natural wood and compatible fixtures are handsomely elegant, again, just right for the space. The bed and working areas are top notch. As others have noted, the only glitch in the offering, if you have to fall for it, is the parking rate, now up to $39/day. There are many other self-parking options in the neighborhood, all apparently safe. I managed to leave our rental car on the street each night for a grand total of $0. If you need to be caressed by valet service, and donâ€™t mind that cost, go for it. The service level undoubtedly is on par with all of the other interactions. But if youâ€™re failingly cost-conscious, donâ€™t fret; on-street parking and takeaway from the fab WholeFoods in the complex should make you consider moving into the PanPacific for an extended vacationâ€¦.

Reviews.Title: “View of Space Needle . . . plus a Whole Foods Market”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for two nights in a corner room at Pan Pacific Seattle. We found it to be a clean and friendly hotel with wide, quiet halls and an iconic view through tall windows. Location The hotel is located in an interesting complex with a Starbuckâ€™s, cards/gifts shop, and a pet store. There's a nice public park, Denny Park, kitty-corner, that is great for walking, and it ensures that no buildings will block the view of the Space Needle. Best of all, downstairs (accessible by lift and escalator) is a giant Whole Foods Market. The Whole Foods Market provides all kinds of breakfast lunch and dinner foods and tables. If you select a steak, theyâ€™ll cook it for you, and you can sit down and eat it. The most interesting shops would be along Westlake Street. We walked to Pike's Place, stopping at Serious Pie on Virginia Street near 4th Avenue for a Yukon potato pizza. We had taken the Gourmet Seattle tour, and we were not impressed with any of the "gourmet" dishes except the potato pizza. Restaurant We were happy to find that Seastar restaurant is accessible through the hotel. It has excellent food. The hotel provides a coupon for a free soup or salad. We especially enjoyed the crab and corn bisque and halibut with artichokes and mushrooms. There is also a pizza restaurant, Tutta Bella, next to the Seastar. Room Or room was quite large with a view of the Space Needle from the desk, the bed, and the bathroom sink. A coffee maker and a hair dryer are in the closet, but in order to be used, they have to be moved to a location where there is an electric plug. The refrigerator was cold but there was no freezer. There are both a phone and a temperature control in the bathroom. We received a free newspaper every day. Quiet enjoyment The fourth floor may be a bit low for light sleepers because trucks go up a grade on the Denny Way side of the room. The windows are double windows and we had no problem with the traffic noise. No neighbor noise, not even footsteps overhead. Internet Everyone gets free Internet. A huge plus. We used only wireless because the signal was good and strong and we couldn't find a LAN cable in the desk. Concierge The doormen are special here. The concierge personnel open the door and engage guests in conversation which makes them seem especially friendly and helpful. The concierge, I think it was Mike, gave us a lift in the hotel car to the Space Needle (uphill) and we walked back to the hotel (downhill). We ate lunch at SkyCity and found the food and service to be a good value and not overpriced. We were enchanted with our stay at the Pan Pacific Seattle, not only for the attentiveness of the staff and a great view, but also for the proximity to downtown and (most of all) the Whole Foods Market. An unusual value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: HPSGene
Reviews.Content: Just an excellent experience all around. Very quick check in process. Extremely clean and comfortable rooms. The location is great. We walked several times to Pikes Market (alot of fun!) and all of the other tourist areas. The Seastar restaurant appeared to be popular and well received. We didn't dine there, but had late night cocktails and had great service from the staff. Having the Whole Foods, Starbucks, trolley and bus lines right there was an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful short stay”
Reviews.Author: MJuJu
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at the Pan Pacific. Love it because it's a no smoking hotel. Having Whole Foods nearby is so convenient. And it's really not far from downtown & all the restaurants. The size of the room is just right. I requested a room away from the street & the hotel complied. Very clean. Nice bed. Nice bathroom. And great rates! What else can you ask for. Will definitely come back. Thanks for keeping the hotel in great shape!

Reviews.Title: “i want to live here”
Reviews.Author: mrsjar97
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary here. This was such a nice hotel! The location is a little bit outside of downtown but still very walkable. We could walk to downtown shopping, Pikes Market and restaurants. The only reason we got a car was to drive to the mountain. The Seastar restaurant downstairs was remarkable! They had crab merus which are the gigantic crab legs. The bed was the most comfortable ever. No wonder the Royal Family uses them. Staff was very friendly and helpful. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: HappyCamper20010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Pan Pacific for four nights. The hotel is marvelous and the staff extremely helpful. We have frequented other hotels in Seattle in the past but, based on Trip Advisor recommendations, tried Pan Pacific this time. Needless to say, we will be returning there from now on. ALSO, the Whole Foods on the lower level is extremely convenient and can help save on food budget. And if you are ready to splurge a little, the hotel's restaurant -- Sea Star -- was exceptional. We hardly ever eat at hotel restaurants. And Seattle has some wonderful dining alternatives! But a very late flight left us tired and unwilling to go out and about. So we tried Sea Star. It was so good, we returned to nights later.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: snagee
Reviews.Content: Top Ten list: 10. Everyone knows your name. 9. Elevator to Whole Foods. 8. Registration desk connected to Starbucks side door. 7. ON both the trolley and bus lines. 6. No extra charge for cot for the kids. 5. Chaise lounge that's long enough for a child to sleep on, and they provide extra bedding for that. 4. Even the least expensive rooms seem luxurious. 3. Sleek styling with sliding shade that opens the bathtub area out to the main room. 2. High-end and beautifully functioning sink, garden bathtub, bed, TV, and iPod-ready alarm clock. 1. Quiet and peaceful with views that make you want to leisurely get ready for your day.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: alderion
Reviews.Content: We stopped here on our way back from Centralia to break up the trip for our daughter. Staff was very helpful and we got the rate that included free valet parking so was less than $300 including parking for the night. The room was nice clean and well laid out. We didn't like the pillows and said so in a survey. The GM emailed me back indicating that they had made a note of this and in future they would be sure we got a different type. Very impressive. Most surveys I have done in the past are likely redirected to the garbage bin or at best read by some underling that doesn't do anything with them other than compile some statistics. Someone mentioned in a previous review there is nowhere to get a pop? We were there July 24th theres a big food market on the ground level. Didn't see if they had that particular brand of pop but the place is huge they had beer wine and every type of grocery imagineable. There is also a s starbucks and many other stores within one mile. I am sure the concierge would have been more than happy to advise the directions of the nearest store. If you need something at this place be sure to ask they will help you. But it's not exactly cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JWolff72
Reviews.Content: Worth the stay. It is right above whole foods so when traveling and just need a salad and quiet night after a busy day it is perfect. The staff is always very helpful and polite. Walking to everything in the city. And a 15 dollar cab ride to the best gelato in the western US: D'Ambrosio Gelato in Ballard on Ballard Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location and service.”
Reviews.Author: carmat3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located near to down town. There are others in the middle of down town but this location works great. Very nice room with view of space needle and down town. Whole foods down stairs and Starbucks. The room wasn't as big as expected but nice furnished, also bed was comfortable. The open bathroom feature was interesting but I'm not personally into it. Parking here is expensive, $39.00 a night to valet park, but your options are limited since all around the hotel is paid parking with 2 or 3 hr limit until like 7 I believe. Free parking on street on Sundays. If your renting a car in Seattle make sure you rent away from the airport if you possibly can. Lots of extra taxes and fees at rental locations near airport. I would take the rail to downtown and rent there, do your homework. Walk to space needle was a few blocks and very pleasant. Took taxis or walked to downtown most of the time, remember parking around Seattle is tough.

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ChelleO
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Pan Pacific Seattle several times, and it's always wonderful! I've stayed with my husband, my mother, and with girlfriends, all on separate occasions. It seems to be the perfect hotel regardless of my travel partners or plans. The service is top notch - they jump to take care of any special requests. The doormen will even greet you with an umbrella if it's raining! The rooms are lovely, and the beds are incredibly comfortable! The showers even have good pressure. My only complaint about the rooms - no place to hang my wash cloth or hand towel. That's a very small complaint! The hotel location is convenient for all the best Seattle attractions. It's within walking distance to downtown shopping, the Space Needle & Key Arena, Pike Street Market, and even Qwest Field & Safeco Field for football & baseball games if you're feeling ambitious. If not, it's easy to catch a bus to the games...or the hotel will gladly provide a Towne Car (don't forget gratuity!). I love the restaurants in the hotel - Sea Star & Tutabella. Sea Star has wonderful sushi & other seafood items, while Tutabella has amazing pizza & other Italian fare. I'm not even interested in other Seattle hotels anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Just short of spectacular...”
Reviews.Author: Lael_Lael
Reviews.Content: The property is very nice and the staff extremely accommodating (if a bit disorganized). We moved rooms after our first night and were given a significantly larger room several floors higher up. Somewhere in the process we lost my shoes, my boyfriend's ID and my makeup bag.... the shoes made it to our new room by the end of the day, but the other things were never recovered. The fitness center, locker rooms and hot tub are very nice, as is having a Whole Foods Market downstairs. Starbucks flooded the Whole Foods and the Hotel lobby during our stay, but that could have happened anywhere. At 2:30pm our last day the staff inquired if we were checking out and we stayed in our room maybe until 3. The book provided in the room was among the most informative I've encountered, including everything from international dialing codes to the price of a hand towel. Coupons for the on site spa, a salon and an eatery were also included. The look of the place is very current, modern, with clean lines and high quality richly textured materials. The baths, with windows opening to the main room are a particularly nice touch. I was less than thrilled with the location... just far enough from Belltown that to walk there and back in heels was not a very desirable option.

Reviews.Title: “Less than expected for a 4 star hotel at well over $300 per night.”
Reviews.Author: jthreed
Reviews.Content: Seattle is expensive. We were prepared for that on our visit. We travel for pleasure about once a quarter and like to stay in the nicest places possible. We booked this hotel based on reviews from Trip Advisor. We paid rack rate of $305 per night plus taxes plus $39 per night for parking. We have stayed in mega suites in Vegas for less. My complaints are : had to request tea (coffee available in room but had to call and ask for tea), after returning to our room at 2pm after sigh-seeing, had to request housekeeping, no evening turn down service and my husband ordered 2 diet cokes from room service and it was $12. (no where within a mile to buy a diet coke) this hotel is identical to the Intercontinental in Atlanta we stay in for half the price. There is nothing wrong with the hotel except they don't miss an opportunity to price gauge its customers.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: OCBB
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a good location for most of the city sites. The employees try their best (it seems) they are not in the same level of service as other Pan Pacific Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “It is a great place”
Reviews.Author: M6Daddy
Reviews.Content: The place is centrally located and has great access to eating establishments. I would stay here again and again. Please help me eat there again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl4674
Reviews.Content: Loved our room. We had a king bed with a sofa bed for our son. Loved the deep soaking tub. The location was great for our needs. We took a cab to the aquarium. Then we walked to the Clipper Ferry pier and checked in for our morning ferry ride. Then we cabbed back to the Pan Pacific. Had dinner at the Tutta Bella Neopolitan Pizza place next door (just steps away from the hotel front door). Then took the outdoor elevator down and into the Whole Foods. Literally the door opens and you are inside the grocery store. We got gelato icecream and a loaf of bread. Also there is a Starbucks next to the entrance of the hotel. The guest services people were very nice and gave our son a coloring book and a stuffed bear. They brought chilled water to us in our room and we used our wine glasses to toast to the start of our vacation! Thank you Pan.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, mod style”
Reviews.Author: jenna0043
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in a Balcony Suite, which was light-filled, spacious, and very functional. I chose it because of the location--it was near the Harry Potter event at the Science Center (stop laughing). The restaurant downstairs is pricey, but quite good with many inventive dishes. Road noise was a little loud, but generally pretty mild for a city hotel. If you are planning to spend most of your time by the water/Pike Place/etc., I'd probably recommended getting a hotel down there given the distance, but Pan Pacific is near the Science Center, Space Needle, and that complex. We used valet parking, because the parking lot out front is shared by many businesses--however, I later saw that they had a self-park entry to the garage off the street. You can walk out to several businesses, including yoga, food places, spa, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: jbg56
Reviews.Content: After struggling to select a hotel in Seattle, I settled on the Pan Pacific as recommended by my son who we went to visit there. While we opted to keep the unusual Asian-inspired sliding doors to the bathroom closed throughout our trip (if left open, the room seems bigger) , the room was nicely appointed, quiet, and very comfortable. We had a huge window that provided a view of some construction areas, a lake, and (to the side), the Space Needle. At times, we watched sea planes take off and land on the water. There is a Whole Foods Market directly below the hotel which was a huge plus for us since we could pop in there for coffee, snacks, beverages, etc. There's also a Bank of America which proved useful to us also. A few things I would have liked in the room: one of those mirrors that enlarges the image (for facial fussing) or at least a lighted mirror, and a toilet separate of the rest of the bathroom, ... but these were not deal breakers. On the positive side: very clean, nice quality soap/shampoo/etc, Wi Fi worked well, full-length mirror, plenty of surface area in bathroom, and an umbrella in the closet! The staff were clearly on high customer service mode and seemed very eager to please while we were there and following up the trip via e-mail afterwards. Neat note: When I asked about a fridge, the staff member said they could clear out the pre-stocked refrigerator already there. Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, highly recommend to anyone!”
Reviews.Author: Huskies04
Reviews.Content: We had a company night out in Seattle and were able to stay at this hotel for a discounted price so we did. We were very happy we did so. The staff was very nice, the room was awesome. We had a nice city view room. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone needing a place to stay in downtown Seattle. My only letdown (a common one these days at city hotels) was how expensive it was to park the car. $40 a night. But that really is the only complaint I had. It was a very nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location.”
Reviews.Author: Symmes2011
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Seattle, and the Pan Pacific was in a great location. We were able to walk to just about everything, and when I was tired a cab ride was just a few bucks. Whole Foods is below the hotel, which makes it great to pick up snacks and even some wine for a nightcap. The rooms were spacious and I loved the bathroom with separate shower and huge tub. The staff was also very friendly and helpful. The parking is a bit steep so we were able to find street parking but had to move the car one day pretty early...but saved us some money. The gym was very nice as well as the hot tub. Very nice hotel and would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, luxurious hotel”
Reviews.Author: joe_ashcraft
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful hotel, centrally located in downtown Seattle. The service was 5 star, and the staff extremely helpful. The room was amazing. What more is there to say? Terrific place to stay for a vacation trip to Seattle. Oh, and don't forget to try to Neapolitan pizza restaurant right next door. Authentic Naples pizza. Out of this world!

Reviews.Title: “I would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MetteO
Reviews.Content: I only stayed one night, but it was a very nice experience. It's a little pricey, but worth it! My room was huge, very clean and homey. And the bathroom and the tub, oh the tub... The staff was welcoming, kind and helpful. I'm trying to come up with something negative, and okay, I guess the view wasn't much to look at, but that's it. Sadly, I won't be back to Seattle (been there, done that), but if I were to return, I would stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “4 Stars are not enough!”
Reviews.Author: MusicCityTraveler120
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive until departure, you'll notice a difference about Pan Pacific. The entire staff of this 4 star hotel truly understand the guest concept. They have mastered the art of providing service without being invasive. Whether you require valet, taxi or some other item, service was impeccable and prompt. As for comfort, the rooms are spacious and surprisingly comfortable. You can actually relax and enjoy an often needed evening of sleep. When dining, the Pan Pacific relationship with Seastar is a perfect match! It's New York and Paris married in Seattle. Culinary entrees are exquisitely prepared and offer a tantalizing treat for any palate. Few hotels rarely merit their reputation. Pan Pacific exceeds theirs.

Reviews.Title: “We wish we could've stayed there longer.”
Reviews.Author: RedSnapper25
Reviews.Content: We only stayed there for one night. But the room was tastefully furnished and looked new. The room was small, but had comfortable bed and modern bathroom. We found this hotel using Hotwire.com. We had a wonderful stay. Pros: Whole Food and Starbucks are located in the same building. Everything looked new. Cons: A receptionist had a rather cold attitude like, "I'm too busy," kind. But she warmed up to us at the end. A bit away from Downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: purple_iain
Reviews.Content: I stayed at similarly priced hotels in Vancouver and San Francisco on my trip but this was the gem. Very nice hotel indeed with great restaurant attached. Bathrooms were lovely. I thought the Metropolitan in Vancouver was nice but this definately had the edge on it.

Reviews.Title: “We made an excellent choice when we picked this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Sue M
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific is a lovely hotel with exceptionally friendly staff. My husband and I stayed there the night before a cruise and the night after we returned to port. We were particularly fortunate that our room was available at 8:30 a.m. the morning we got off the ship. We had a room with two beds on a high floor facing the Space Needle. There was no traffic noise and no noise from other rooms. The room was clean, spacious, very modern and well equipped. We were not particularly impressed with the sliding panels that allowed a view of the room from the bathroom and vice versa. But, once we closed the panels, it was fine. The hotel is in a nice location near shops and restaurants. There is a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby and a Whole Foods just below it. Finding the entrance to the hotel is a bit tricky--we drove around a couple of times before we located the turn. But, that was a very minor point.

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant hotel”
Reviews.Author: ezzy4751
Reviews.Content: Understated Asian style with interesting art throughout the property and excellent bathrooms. Unique, delicious room service menu. Great gym with lots of equipment. Downstairs is a Whole Foods and a brilliant Neapolitan pizza place, Tutta Bella. Definitely order a pie.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, okay location, spotty service”
Reviews.Author: Snowkarver
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for a family long weekend with our toddler. Since this is a newer property, the overall design and condition of the rooms and public spaces were top notch, as were the furnishings and amenities. Especially appreciated were the floor to ceiling windows, great views of the Space Needle and mountains, and the peekaboo shower and bath, which turned out to be great for keeping an eye on the little one and watching TV from the tub. The location is a bit unusual, sandwiched between downtown and Seattle Center, but not really close to either. On a nice day, it's a short enough walk to these attractions even with a four year-old, but by the end of the day, we were tired enough to have to take a cab back to the hotel (about 8-10 bucks depending on traffic). On the plus side, there's a really nice Whole Foods downstairs which means endless drinks and snacks for a reasonable price. For a 4 1/2 star hotel, the service was a little disappointing. While the front desk was pleasant, the general responsiveness of the staff was not up to the standards I normally expect in this price range. On arrival, we were pretty much ignored by the valet for ten minutes as he took a call at his kiosk. Getting some extra bedding took two calls to housekeeping, and although we called down fifteen minutes in advance to retrieve our car, they didn't bother, and we had to wait around for them to get it only after we had checked out. Overall, this is a nice enough property, but the service does need a bit more polish for it to really be called a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Decadent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Pineapple9999
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful time at the Pan Pacific. The rooms were gorgeous- loved the bathroom shoji screen seperating the bedroom so I could linger in the tub and still talk to my hubby on the bed watching TV. We found free parking near Denny Park and walked to the hotel! Whole Foods is under the hotel which was great- yummy coffee and deli fare. We hopped the bus to downtown and shopped and had dinner. I would definately recommend the Pan Pacific- terrific customer service, lovely rooms and the proximity to Whole Foods was terrific! The amenities were also lovely (bathrobest, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and very family friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Jen325basile
Reviews.Content: We went up to Seattle for a weekend trip from Portland, OR...loved it! First thing when we checked in with our toddler they gave him this really nice stuffed panda bear. The room was great and located next to Whole Foods and various restaurants. It only took us a quick 15-min walk to the market. Great place and recommend it for families that want to be conveniently located to a market and downtown activities.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kmbldmk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business trip and it was a great place to stay. I recommend the Pan Pacific for business or pleasure. It is comfortable, clean, quiet and the staff is excellent. It is just a few blocks from the Seattle Center and only a 10-15 walk to Pikes Market. I was very pleased with my stay. They gave me free wi-fi and there are many options of places to eat near by. The SeaStar Restaurant is one of the best in the area. Thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy85
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Pan Pacific, I knew we were onto a good thing. This hotel is gorgeous with service to match. We arrived early, about 10am and our room was not ready so the lovely lady at the front desk moved us to a higher floor so that we could check in right away. The room was stunning with lots of room to move and had a large bathroom with a nice big bath for relaxing after a long day. The hotel is conveniently located about a 10-15 minute walk from the centre of town and about the same to the Space Needle. In fact this hotel made getting to all the sites very accessible. The Starbucks next door is handy for a quick morning caffine hit and the supermarket, whilst a tad expensive, is very convenient. The price is fantastic, we got a very good deal. I suspect the price is due to its location outside the exact city centre but really, the walk is nothing and well worth the $$$ saved! I'll certainly be staying here again when I return to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “A Seattle Favorite”
Reviews.Author: wheresmuffy
Reviews.Content: I really love the Pan Pacific. I've stayed here for business twice and it is incredibly conveniently located. There is a Whole Foods, Tutta Bella, Starbucks, Bank of America, and pharmacy all within steps of the hotel. In regards to transportation, the South Lake Union Transit stops in front of the hotel and the hotel also offers a Lincoln Towncar that will take you anywhere within a 2 mile radius. The rooms are well appointed and have very comfortable beds and great bathtubs! One word of caution, the tile floors in the bathroom are quite slippery if you're wearing socks so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service. Will be back for sure!”
Reviews.Author: PuraVida2010CostaRic
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with every aspect of our stay with the Pan Pacific. One of my biggest surprises was the complimentary WIFI service. This is rare at a nicer hotel. We visited the Seattle Aquarium, Woodland Park Zoo, Pikes Place Market, and of course shopping downtown Seattle. The hotel was right in the middel of it all.

Reviews.Title: “professional luxury and Whole Foods!”
Reviews.Author: ITNtraveler
Reviews.Content: The location was premium to where my meetings were held, the rooms were gorgeous, I had very restful sleep, and they had their own Whole Foods downstairs making quick snacks and on the go meals a snap! The staff was very courteous, and I was sad to check out. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: mikethe6th
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I've had the pleasure of staying at. Service was amazing, rooms were gorgeous and the bathroom was spot on.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: bffchic22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a weekend in April (Mariner's opening night) and the hotel was truly lovely. When we arrived we were put in a room that did not have the screens opening the bathroom to the bedroom so we called and they put us in a different room. The websites for the hotel claim that all rooms have this feature, but I guess there are a couple that don't so requesting them in advance might be a good idea. The location isn't great-besides the Whole Foods underneath it, but the hotel makes up for it in its beauty and modernity. It's quite small-lobby area was pretty tiny, but the design is excellent. Parking is quite expensive-about 30$ a night for valet, but most Seattle hotels are similar in price. One problem we did have was a lack of taxis. Many times the curbside attendants put us in an unmarked towncar where there was a flat price for where we wanted to go. And the drivers never had change on them, so for a 10$ ride you would be force to tip 10$ if all you had on you was 20s like we did. The drivers were also very shady, trying to drop us off blocks away from our destination. Don't ride in the towncars, wait for a taxi! The room was great-a nice big bed and a flat screen TV. The bathrooms were beautiful and we enjoyed the soaking tub with a bottle of champagne. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “We'll surely stay in the Pan Pacific Hotel again in our next visit to Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: gv888
Reviews.Content: Clean, bright, and well-furnished room - we just didn't get the Space Needle view though. Large bathroom with separate tub and shower. Friendly and accomodating staff, fast service. The Seastar Restaurant next to the hotel is a must try - especially the Cedar Plank Roasted Wild Salmon. The WholeFoods nearby is so convenient. Also close to the Portage Bay Cafe, if you like to try the best homegrown, organic breakfast/lunch Seattle has to offer. Not located in Central downtown, but we didn't mind the walk along Westlake. About 20 minutes walk to the Pike Place Public Market - and the hotel's free limo service can take you there in about 5 minutes or anywhere downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home...”
Reviews.Author: amarty76
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. It's my home away from home. The staff are wonderful always friendly and accomodating. It's has an extrememly convientent location. Whole foods downstairs is an added bonus. I wish I had more time to stay and enjoy the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Sister Night Out!”
Reviews.Author: lsanborn
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for her birthday and it was fabulous. Great service from the minute we pulled up to valet. Love the room with a view of the space needle. After playing out we decided to some back and do room service. We both took hot baths and then had a great room service dinner! In the morning we visited the spa for facials and that was the ultimate pampering! I wished I was staying a few nights...I will be back for sure and next time dine at my favorite restaurant there...Seastar!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality hotel with polite staff, suppose all cities are noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: divebuddy99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is of a fantastic standard and pays very particular detail to customer needs. The beds and pillows are the best quality and the hotel is kept in an excellent condition. Considering the age of the hotel, I would have thought more could be done to improve the sound proofing especially from the main road outside. Buses are the worst culprits as they shift down gears to get up the hill, northbound on Westlake Avenue. The service is great with very friendly staff. The only criticsm on service was that breakfast took far too long and one evening, the bar was closed at 6pm - 8pm due to staff shortage!! The hotel has a gym but this became crowded during morning and evening peak times as there was not enough cardio equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Low key luxury”
Reviews.Author: katiepenney
Reviews.Content: Very friendly service oriented spot with terrific amenities. Fabulous restaurant attached and located over a Whole Foods!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, great location + wholefoods downstairs!”
Reviews.Author: IanBTotteridge
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel, large rooms, with very comfortable beds and free wifi. Wholefoods supermarket below the hotel is fantastic. Small bar but reasonably busy with great cheesy popcorn. Within walking distance of all major attractions, 15 mins to Pike Place, 10 mins to Space Needle, 7 mins to main shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan luxury”
Reviews.Author: KVAMPBELLA
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Seattle. I loved the hotel. It was beautiful and located near everything I wanted to see and do. It was within walking distance. The room was lovely. The valet parking was fantastic. I loved having the Whole Foods store and Starbucks just downstairs. The hotel rooms had a special mattress called hypnotic. Perhaps I am just used to my own bed but I nor my husband could not get comfortable on it.. The touch I liked the most was a copy of a book Called what to read on a rainy day with stories from various local unknown writers. That you were welcome to take with you and they charge it to your room when you leave. I bought the book and appreciate that they promote literacy and local writers.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception and Dinner at the Pan Pacific”
Reviews.Author: dyoung5778
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel and very comfortable. The rooms and views of Seattle were perfect. What a place to celebrate a wedding! We will come back when we have concerts in Seattle, it's the perfect overnight getaway for enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Made our anniversary perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: lsmith1978
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the pan pacific hotel for our anniversary. It was awesome! The beds were so nice and the accomodations were fabulous! We had never been to Seattle and we are so glad we chose this hotel. we will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “would definitely stay agin”
Reviews.Author: Kmaef
Reviews.Content: Beautiful entrance/front desk area. Amazing food and service at the Seastar restaurant. Very comfy beds. Nice bathrooms. Very quiet!! great gym and spa.

Reviews.Title: “A little off beaten path, but great relaxing beautiful place.”
Reviews.Author: Mrp73
Reviews.Content: I made the mistake of not staying longer, it was a great hotel, we parked on the street which worked great for us, walked to both downtown very easily, and having whole foods under you was a great place to explore. The service was outstanding, the room was nicely laid out and very clean and welcoming. Will hopefully be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: belmikey
Reviews.Content: I came to Seattle for an interview. You never really know what sort of hotel you're going to get put up in for that sort of trip. I mean, no reasonable would-be employer is going to put you up in a dive, but they're not necessarily going to splurge, either. So the Pan Pacific was a very pleasant surprise. While the room wasn't huge, every facet of the room was clearly designed to enhance a sense of comfort -- both physical comfort and comfort with one's surroundings. I was particularly pleased with the bathroom, which had both a standing, glass-enclosed shower and a separate, deep bathtub. Even better was the decision to have a window through from the bedroom to the bathroom (with shutters for those of you who prefer complete privacy), allowing natural light from the large main windows in and allowing me to leave the bathroom lights off. I appreciated this both for being able to save the electricity and for ambiance, as my visit coincided with a rare sunny day in Seattle in February, and the natural light filtering in really was more than adequate. It also helped the comparatively small room feel larger to have the bathroom more "integrated" with the space. In short, the room provided an excellent sense of "refuge", a comfortable home base for a person in a strange town under stressful circumstances. I did not have much need to rely on the hotel's staff, but what little interaction I had on check-in and check-out were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Went for business -- would go back for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: dallenboston
Reviews.Content: Smart, modern hotel in great location. Beautifully planned -- they put their money where it counts so rooms are small but efficient and comfortable. Yoga, Starbucks, nice restaurants, Whole Foods all in spitting distance and downtown an easy walk away.

Reviews.Title: “In all my travels, I've never had a better experience”
Reviews.Author: MartyM30
Reviews.Content: I get to travel a couple times a year and I've been fortunate to visit some very nice places. We stayed at the Pan Pacific in Seattle for our anniversary and it was the best we've been to yet. Everything about it was great from the people to the facilities. Every employee was genuinely friendly and quick to ask if there was anything we needed. The fitness center was amazing, it had everything. If there was ever a "complaint" I've had at nicer hotels, it's that I can never sleep. In the Pan Pacific, I finally found a place with a truly comfortable bed. If I ever make it back to Seattle, which I hope I do, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best hotel in Seattle - large but with boutique-level service”
Reviews.Author: shell202020
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. The staff are wonderful, the rooms are great, the bathrooms are sensational. Unlike most other hotels, I never heard noise from adjacent rooms or the hallway during my stay. There were about 60 TV channels which is unusual in a large hotel. The lobby is lovely with a really nice bar, and a highly-rated seafood restaurant next door. It is far enough from the city center to be peaceful and quiet, but only a 15-minute walk to downtown or the Space Needle. The famous Thirteen Coins Restaurant is a three-minute walk away. The hotel provides complimentary car service to the downtown area during certain weekday hours. Meanwhile there is a fantastic Whole Foods downstairs and a Starbucks adjacent to the lobby. I loved spending the day downtown and then coming back to this wonderful hotel at the end of the day. I loved my stay here would never stay anywhere else in Seattle. N.B. reviewers who say they prefer the Hyatt are crazy - I stopped in just to compare and was so glad I wasn't staying there, when the Pan Pacific is so much more charming and with personal and attentive service.

Reviews.Title: “Superb ...”
Reviews.Author: MarvMartSA
Reviews.Content: I have just completed a 2 weeks stay at the Pan Pacific, and there is no other word to describe it as superb ... EVERYONE is friendly and are always looking after you needs. from the moment i arrived to the moment I left the hotel. The rooms are comfortable, with the bathroom opening up onto the Bedroom, which is both different and nice to have... You can watch TV from the bath... Oh yeah and as an added bonus you can see the space needle which while I did not really look at the view is a nice "value add" The Gym is well equipped and modern, however it is across the courtyard and not in the gym, having said that, there are umbrellas in the room either way so it does not make a difference. The bar downstairs is nice to sit downstairs and relax which I did on a couple of occasions . *If* I had to give a negative, it was that the food that I had from room service was not that great. I only ordered once (the burger) and I did not enjoy it at all. A small point as there are many other restaurants withi a couple of minutes walk (Including a couple within the same block. Last of all,is the fact that with regards to location it is pretty much close to everything.I walked everywhere. Pike Place is probably 30 minutes walk away (or probably 10 minutes by cab), with Space Needle 6 blocks away. All in all it was great, and i would most definitely recommend it and when I go back to Seattle it will be my 1st choice of Hotel

Reviews.Title: “super nice”
Reviews.Author: kurtisak
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in every "nice" hotel in Seattle and the Pan Pacific is by far our favorite. Whole foods down the elevator is the best and the staff is very professional and courteous. You can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable”
Reviews.Author: mockje
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an unexpected gift at the end of our vacation. My wife and I had just returned from a week long cruise to Alaska and looked to stay an extra night in Seattle to tour around. We found this hotel on Kayak with good reviews at about $120 a night. We decided to take the plunge and we were so thankful we did. The hotel is located just outside of "downtown". Close enough to walk, far enough to be quite and peaceful. We were treated extremely friendly by the staff from the second we walked in the door. They put us in a top level room with corner views of the city/harbor. The room was excellent with great upgrades and a romantic setting. As my wife and I were on foot with out luggage, the staff were extremely accommodating. The surrounding amenities are was great as well. Across the street, they have access to terrific gym with all the to date equipment you could ask for. Just below the hotel is a natural foods store that is great for food and snacks. So down to the real question, would I return to this hotel if I were to visit Seattle again? 10x over YES.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, good location, great service”
Reviews.Author: shaz_aussie39
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in late December with husband, two kids (aged 11 & 14) and my Mum who is 66. We got a great rate by emailing the hotel direct as we needed 3 rooms. They gave the kids and us connecting rooms and my Mum was on the same floor. The check in service was extremely quick, the rooms were exactly as we requested. The location is great with only a 5 - 10 minute walk into the city centre and from there we accessed the monorail to the space needle & musice/sci fi museum. Having Wholefoods underneath was fabulous as we could just have a meal down there or take some snacks back to our room Overall we were extremely happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “excellence and professionalism of the highest standard!”
Reviews.Author: contessa10
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Pan Pacific over New Year and were so impressed with the sheer professionalism and quiet friendliness of the staff, from the door to the desk and throughout the hotel. our room was lovely, immaculately clean with a great view of the Space Needle from which we watched the firework display. the bed was probably the most comfortable hotel bed we've slept in and the bed linen was gorgeous! downtown attractions are only a 15-minute max walk away and the bonus of having a Whole Foods market right on our doorstep was great. we will definitely choose this hotel again the next time we visit Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again when I go back to Seattle.”
Reviews.Author: linya27
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent our Christmas 2010 weekend in Seattle. Our stay at Pan Pacific was hassle-free. Staffs are very friendly and accommodating. Service quality at its best. Rooms are clean and awesome!! Almost all of the restaurant are closed there at Christmas Day, but the staff was really helpful in finding us a place to eat that night. He even printed us a map for the directions. Vicinity of the hotel is very near downtown Seattle. Pretty much everything is walking distance from the hotel (or maybe because I just love walking). Space Needle is about a good 10-15 minute walk. Pike Place or downtown area about 20 mins. or less. Really a good value for money. Would definitely stay there again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful big rooms, good room service, big windows”
Reviews.Author: Winetourist80
Reviews.Content: Very attentive staff without being at all invasive, and courtesy car for short distances. The rooms are spacious, huge bed, ceiling to floor windows, peaceful. City view can be of another building mind, but I didn't really mind.

Reviews.Title: “a pleasant, comfortable,relaxing place and great service”
Reviews.Author: jeanl54
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay at this hotel, great service and lovely people, nice location and a fabulous restaurant. Go there you won't be disappointed

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!”
Reviews.Author: lsanborn
Reviews.Content: What a great escape for shopping, dining, spa and all you could want. Amazing service, great food at my favorite restaurant Seastar, love the spa, was treated like a queen by staff. I will be back over and over again!! Great location to everything too!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and View”
Reviews.Author: JoeFargo
Reviews.Content: This was a short 3 night vacation stay. I wanted a very clean comfortable room with a view and a nice bathtub and that is exactly what we got. Oh what a view! We had the corner room on the 7th floor and could see the city from 180 degrees as the photos show. The king bed was extremely comfortable. We could have stayed in that hotel and never left. The free wireless Internet worked perfect, tv was good, room was immaculate. We never ordered room service or went to the hotel restaurant so don't know how that rated. The Whole Foods Market attached to hotel was very convenient. The gym is in building next door which wasn't as convenient so I never saw that. The downtown location is great, between Seattle Center and Westlake Center mall. There is a very modern street car out front that will take you south to Westlake Center or north to Union Lake area. We never took a cab or needed a car the entire visit. We took the train from airport to Westlake Center which only costs $2.50 one way and is very quick! We also walked to Seattle Aquarium and Pikes Place. All in all this is a great place to stay if you love downtown Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking...”
Reviews.Author: BPOS365
Reviews.Content: I have tried many hotels in the Seattle area (and Eastside) and none of them have been able to compete with the excellent level of quality, cleanliness, modernity and service that the Pan Pacific provides. Don't waste your time or money elsewhere, the Pan Pacific is the only game in town as far as I am concerned.

Reviews.Title: “asian sensibilities with comfort”
Reviews.Author: DoctorM
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend stay at the Pan Pacific in Seattle. Really like the feature of having a bath tub with sliding panel walls so you could soak in the tub and still see the stunning view of the Space Needle only 8 blocks away. You know this hotel favors Asian clients when the room temp is set at 78 degrees but that digital thermostat works well. The staff is exceptionally helpful and their answer to almost every request is 'Yes, of course". A reasonable walk to Pike Place and downtown IF you are physically fit. Otherwise, you will be paying for cab rides around the city. Be sure to check out the Whole Foods on the street level.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, I'd definitely stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: barby_travels
Reviews.Content: Hubby's company paid all the expenses, as he was there for work, but I went along for leisure. Our a queen room was huge as well as the bathroom. We could see the Space Needle from the window. There's a iron and ironing board, the hairdryer, lots of towels, free internet (wi-fi and cable), a huge TV, fridge and so on. If you suffer the jet-lag, you won't get bored at night. The hotel's position is great too. It's very silent, 10 minute walk from the city center, 20 from the spike market and 20 from the Space Needle. Starbucks and a food market is just next door as well as a pizzeria where we ate our best pizza abroad ever. The staff is very friendly. They always greet you when you go out or go back. There's a complimentary fitness center with jacuzzi and sauna open 24/7. I definitely recommend this hotel, we enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: robakking
Reviews.Content: THis hotel is clean and friendly in a very safe area of town. Having a Starbucks and a whole foods in the same building was awesome. The spa was very nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Sparkling clean, Great for pets!”
Reviews.Author: maggiemay1969
Reviews.Content: We live in the area and the only reason we stayed at the Pan Pacific Seattle was because we had won a free night's stay at a charity auction for fallen police officers. Anyways, we realized that the expiration was coming up soon so we called to check availability and sure enough the next night was available. We found the parking garage easily enough, but were shocked that it was $35, (yes, $35, that's not a typo) to park for 24 hours! Holy cow!...Oh well, it IS Seattle! We sucked it up and paid. Check in was extremely simple and friendly and we had to sign a waiver for our two yellow labs that we brought with us at a charge of $50 for the night. We were aware of this in advance and had no problem with it. Loved how you have to have a room keycard to activate the elevator. Awesome security feature, although this part of town doesn't feel at all unsafe. We got to our room on the third floor and were pleasantly shocked to find that they had given us an amazing room with a full on view of the Space Needle all lit up at night. Simply gorgeous. (Room #309) The room itself couldn't have been cleaner. Very modern, tasteful furnishings, and very nice comfortable beds and linens. Their down comforters were great. The bathroom literally sparkled. It was HUGE, had a cool eco-friendly water saving toilet, and very high quality, good smelling shampoo/conditioner/lotion kit. I even used the tub for a long hot soak, while watching TV (a very nice good sized newer either LCD or plasma) with the Shoji screens that separate the bedroom area from the bath wide open. Kinda cool. Further on the bath-The tub is humongous/very deep and super clean (I am not usually one to use the tub at a hotel, but...I couldn't resist) The shower was also enormous and spotless, very roomy. Light bathrobes are provided which is always nice. There was a safe, iron/ironing board etc too. Since it is a pet-friendly hotel, there were of course, large raised stainless steel doggy bowls complete with special doggy treats from the boutique doggy shop across the plaza. Nice touch to us dog lovers! Although it is very expensive, we loved having the ability to walk downstairs to pick up late night snacks at the Whole Foods Market. We only stayed for the one night, so we didn't get the chance to walk around and shop, although GREAT shopping is just blocks from this location. I can't think of a reason that we would ever need to stay at a hotel in Seattle since we live less than 30 minutes south of the city, but it definitely was a cool place to stay for a change of pace/romantic evening and I would whole-heartedly reccommend the Pan Pacific to anyone looking for a VERY nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: gileyal
Reviews.Content: I visited while interviewing for a local company. I fell in love with this hotel - great service, gorgeous room. Staff is extremely helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: baol1969
Reviews.Content: Excellent business hotel with all amenities and high quality of services very conveniently located. Very spacious and comfortable rooms. Very good restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service, quality and value”
Reviews.Author: delbz
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived I was treated like a preferred guest. The Pan Pacific Seattle is a lovely modern hotel with friendly, efficient and helpful staff. I was given a room on the top floor and although the view wasn't the best available, it had all the mod cons. Free Wifi - that was awesome! The bath was great too. The doormen were very helpful - offering an umbrella and complementary driver anywhere within two miles (only in the mornings and evenings though). The hotel is not the most central, but I enjoyed walking around town - seemed very safe. One of the best things was the Whole Foods Market directly below the hotel. Breakfast was had for $4.50 (that's 2 eggs, toast, jam and OJ)!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet comfortable hotel with added internal water features”
Reviews.Author: lochview84
Reviews.Content: During my stay at this hotel while I was on business, my bathroom flooded twice because the people in the room above had overflowed their bathtub. Although both times when the staff at the hotel did there best to rectify the situation, I felt that they saw it as a random occurrence rather than an inconvenience. I have stayed at The Pan Pacific in Whistler before where my expectations about the hotel brand were just beyond my wildest dreams, but this weeks events have led me to doubt the brands reputation, which is something I did not expect.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms, great service!”
Reviews.Author: currygolf
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the location and overall experience at this hotel. The room was stunning and very comfortable. I found the hotel staff to be mostly very helpful and the maids were top notch. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Wonderful Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natsfan24
Reviews.Content: To begin with, I got a package deal that included two free drinks and valet parking so it turned out to be a good deal. This is clearly not Marriott range but with the deal, the pricing wasn't much different for that weekend than the Marriott in Seattle. I like Marriotts but this hotel is in a different class. The bed might be the best bed I have ever slept on in a hotel. The service was wonderful and friendly. The room was great- a lovely layout with well thought out furnishings. It was very quiet and everything worked as it should have. Elevators were fast, valet service was flawless and to top it off, downstairs and in the same building is a Starbucks and a Whole Foods Market. The hotel is a 15 minute walk from Pikes Market and, in the other direction, a 15 minute walk to the Space Needle. REI is just 5 minutes away and worth a visit. I would stay at this hotel anytime I visited Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The Zen of Hotel Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: mbd02140
Reviews.Content: Luckily, my stay was sponsored by my employer, or I might not be able to afford the (simple, elegant) luxury of the Seattle Pan Pacific, but now that I know about this hotel, I may splurge on a stay there in the future. They really have mastered the art of hospitality, but I appreciate most the fact that it's not over the top. The room was beautiful, simple and perfectly proportioned. It's like a cross between a boutique hotel, which I prefer for their attention to design detail, and an executive suite with the room being large enough to move around in, but proportioned for real humans instead of buffaloes (or oversized egos who need a lot of frufru to create atmosphere).

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific Seattle lives up to the chain's reputation”
Reviews.Author: chinochulo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business interview and was thoroughly impressed. The staff was extremely pleasant, courteous, and helpful from the moment you walk in the door, and because this was a repeat visit, they even remembered (more like read the notes on the computer, but still impressive nonetheless) my room and newspaper preferences. The rooms are well-appointed and very suitable for either a business traveler or a leisure traveler. I booked my room through the hotel website's internet specials, so I was able to lock in a rate which included free breakfast; there were other specials which included free parking or free champagne. The location is not exactly "downtown", but then Seattle is a small city, and it is certainly very walkable from this hotel to the Pike Market (~20min walk).

Reviews.Title: “Best accomodations in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: pwebster2
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Pan 4 times now and consider it the absolute best hotel value in Seattle. The people who work there never let me down in regards to there ability to exceed my expectations in service and friendliness. Whoever trains them should be commended. The rooms are spacious, impeccably clean and may have the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on. The new addition to turn down service was a glass jar on each nightstand filled with fresh cool water. Loved it! Vida Spa next door is a must as well for a little slice of decadence. The Pan Pacific continues to be the ONLY place I'll stay in Seattle. Patrick Spokane Washington

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to it's reputation”
Reviews.Author: foma
Reviews.Content: On business in Seattle for two days, I stayed at the very lovely Pan Pacific Hotel. Friendly reception and though I arrived early my room was ready. The rooms were clean, modern and roomy. The bathroom being the highlight of the room. Spacious and comfortably configured, I could even watch the ball game on television while taking a shower. A comfortable bar doubles as the breakfast area which served a very good breakfast. Valet service was very helpful and had my taxi waiting on the morning I was leaving. The location of the hotel is a little out of the way, but Seattle is a small, walkable city and you are not too far from anything the city has to offer. A highly satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and clean”
Reviews.Author: PsyBobcat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so fantastic. The staff are attentive and will do most anything to make your stay comfortable. The rooms are gorgeous and extremely clean. A small issue was that the shower was designed in such a way that the water didn't drain properly - the whole bathroom was wet each time we showered. Another issue was that parking was not free (in fact, I think it was quite expensive) We ended up parking on surrounding streets. Another treat - there is a Whole Foods Market right downstairs - attached to the hotel! I'd stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tike1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a week. The rooms are fabulous - spacious with a very funky open bathroom setup (basically there are panels that slide open to the main bedroom - you can enjoy the view out of the window, or the TV while having a bath!). Everything was immaculately clean and the rooms are large with free wired and wireless internet and a useful desk area. Also good amounts of storage (drawers, wardrobe) and free use of a decent size safe (takes a laptop). Really excellent rooms. Only criticism is the range of channels on the TV (basic channels only). Downstairs is the most amazing Whole Foods Market. We got breakfast, lunch and dinner there. Don't bother with the hotel breakfast - nothing wrong with it but you'll get better, healthier food from the Whole Foods Market for much less money! The location of the hotel is perfect. Maybe a 10 minute walk from South Lake Union, 10 minutes from the Space Needle, and maybe 20 minutes from the main city center. My room had a great view of South Lake Union (but sadly not the needle). Strongly recommend this hotel. Only bad points were the beds are slightly soft for my liking, and the restaurant is overpriced for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel - First class”
Reviews.Author: goingtobim
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pan Pacific for a shopping weekend with my daughter. Terrific hotel - first class amenities, service, etc. Great location. Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel00700
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Pan Pacific was great. The rooms were cozy and the entire staff was friendly and helpful. Their name tags say "I am Pan Pacific" under their names and it truely shows. We were in touch with Erin at the front desk all during the day. She helped with information and reservations as we found things around the city. For breakfast, go to the Portage Bay Cafe a few blocks away. It's all organic, but also very tasty (for those who are not into that). We also were at Pan Pacific in Whistler, BC and had the same experience. The front desk personal are like having a friend when you are away from home. We would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic in every way...”
Reviews.Author: MendoTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just to add my thoughts to the other positive reviews... I'm an experienced traveler, and this is one of the best places to stay, anywhere. From the greetings at door and desk, to the real concern everyone shows to answer your questions, make good suggestions, be flexible when you request anything special... the excellent location -- not in the "heart" of things but close to everything; plus a pleasant four block walk to a great breakfast (Portage Bay Cafe) and a TOP TOP TOP restaurant adjacent (Seastar) -- try the oyster sampler -- all this together makes this place as good as it gets. Highly recommended to all and I definitely do not work for them!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: CascadeRM
Reviews.Content: We did a quick overnight trip to Seattle to play tourists for a day. The hotel's location was perfect for getting to the major attractions by foot, such as the Space Needle, Pikes Place market and the Seattle Aquarium. The hotel is in a nice part of downtown, the streetcar drops off at the door step practically and the property is in fantastic condition. The service of the front desk was great, the rooms were very "cool" and comfortable. Overall we had a great time in Seattle and the Pan Pacific helped ensure it was a comfortable stay as well.

Reviews.Title: “one of the nicest hotels we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: chill55
