Reviews.Content: I travel quite a lot for business and pleasure, and this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at. No matter where my meeting is in Seattle, I stay here because I love it so much. It's not right downtown, but close enough that a short stroll into town is not a problem. The rooms are amazing, usually with great views, super comfortable beds, aeron desk chairs and very nice bathrooms. Considering the cost of the hotel, you'll think you may be staying at the Ritz. The hotel bar is also great with a friendly staff. Unlike other premium hotels, the Pan Pacific does not nickle and dime you, and Internet is free. Right above a Whole Foods is convenient for grabbing a quick meal in your room.

Reviews.Title: “A nice elegant/modern getaway that is close to amenities”
Reviews.Author: kylann
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and modernly decorated. We had a deluxe room with a jacuzzi tub that we really enjoyed!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice downtown with exquisite interior”
Reviews.Author: biaci
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Seattle Pan Pacific hotel in an executive studio king room and must say that it was really a wonderful room with view to the surrounding buildings. The bathroom was huge and perfectly build and the large windows and bathtub facing the window had blinds so that you did not have to stand naked for everyone to watch from the buildings surrounding the Pan Pacific. The only thing I was missing were towel rails and power outlets next to the complementary coffee machine (thus, we had to rearrange the bathroom a bit...). The WiFi worked perfectly well and we can totally recommend having dinner at the adjoining Seastar restaurant which can be accessed by walking across the bar. The food & service were awesome and as it was pouring that night, the perfect choice for us that night in Seattle! Further, the Starbucks next door can also be accessed from the reception area, so we had a very good coffee for breakfast too. If you can get good rates, the Pan Pacific should be your choice, as downtown & Space Needle are within walking distance and a yummy yummy food market is just around the corner, too :-)

Reviews.Title: “what a joke”
Reviews.Author: mistakeinseattle
Reviews.Content: I dont know who they paid to get those 4 star's, but there fake. reserved 2 rooms, exc .king room w/ balcony, and an attached queen for the teen. 1) if you want to use the exerise facilty, YOU HAVE TO WALK ACOSS THE STREET, and share it the 200 or so, condo owners. 2) we stayed halloween night, you are so close to the condo's you could see what the were or were not wearing to holloween. I Dont think me teen got a wink of sleep. 3) Bed way over rated , counldn't wait to get home to my costco pillow top. 4) Turn down service for exc. king, but must not have paid enough for the attached queen, no service. 5) too far away from town, didn't feel like I was even in seattle. 6) the couch was worthless, sunk so low your legs would dangle over the wood frame. Loved the whole foods market.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star resort treatment with a home feel”
Reviews.Author: wtortolero
Reviews.Content: I travelled for business and stayed at the Westin first, then after work was done decided to stay a few extra days to explore and transfer to the Pan Pacific. I read all the reviews and they were very helpful. Well, the hotel is great and the customer service is amazing, consistent no matter who is at the door or front door, eveyone has a smile on thei faces. The rooms are great but the bathrooms are exceptional! Big and roomy, you have a separate shower and a large enough tub to fit two people comfortably. The bed is comfy! It is is in a great location with waliking distance to the Space Needle and downtown area, including the Pike Place Market. The Sea Star restuarant is great and there is an italian restaurant downstairs too that has great pizza and the best tiramissu you'll ever have. I think it's called Tutti. There is a Whole Foods Market downstairs too which is very convenient. It is inside a complex with a pharmacy, spa and a starbucks of course. The only down side is that there is no breakfast at the hotel/ and or breakfast room service, just lunch and dinner. Other than that it is a great hotel, will definetely stay over there again when back in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodations with attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: JohnLA99
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was amazing with THE most comfortable king size bed I have ever slept on. The pillows were not flat square cushions but oversized REAL pillows. The bathroom was a religious experience - it could accommodate six people - it was as larfe as the bedroom. What a treat to have enough room in the main part of the bathroom to turn around but to also have a separate tub and huge shower. The bath towels were thick and smelled amazing - they did not smell like bleach. The front desk staff always acknowledged you when walking past them - coming or going. Staff opened the entry doors when coming and going and the valet staff went a step father to always ask where we were headed and did we know how to get there. The hotel has an adjacent fitness center that was one of the best that I have ever seen. What a pleasurable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Business colleagues, just an FYI !NOT the best!”
Reviews.Author: portland_dave93
Reviews.Content: First off the hotel seems to be in off spot for Seattle. This hotel will nickel and dime your wallet, from the over priced drinks at the bar, to the mini bar in the room.($35 charge just to empty it) (no hotel restaurant, only one attached) Parking is almost $40.00 a night. +tip when they bring your car up, how ever long that takes. Staff, very young, but bright. At first sight of this hotel driving up I noticed a group of men smoking on the side of the hotel, all in suits with name tags. With that said, where are all the managers? I never saw anyone who looks like they where in charge. The hotel is still new but in need of some work. Breakfast in the mornings seems to be the hardest. I never once got a hot breakfast in my room. Items where missing on the cart. (no ice on the floors as well.) I can understand for an older building but not for a four diamond hotel, that is new. Hotel is nice just seams unmanaged, (like at other hotels I see management walking around talking with guest doing what they can to help, this hotel just feels lost, going through the motion only for your $$) not organized at all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine...”
Reviews.Author: karissf
Reviews.Content: I'll admit to booking this hotel because, at the time, it was rated the #1 hotel in Seattle on Tripadvisor. Whilst everything at the Pan Pacific was fine, I imagine it was only #1 because people don't have anything really bad to say about it. We arrived way before check-in hoping to leave our bags before exploring Seattle, but were informed that a room was already available that we could take. In hindsight we should have waited, as this room didn't have any spectacular views.. but it was clean, comfortable and quite fancy. The location wasn't a problem for us - a bit of a walk to the Light Rail station at Westlake Centre but we enjoyed the fresh air! We don't have any complaints (expect for maybe a ridiculous charge for a very short phone call to Portland), but we'll probably check out a different hotel next time we're in Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “The Pan Pacific Seattle is like a 2nd home to us!”
Reviews.Author: LastFrontierSparky
Reviews.Content: It was our 2nd visit to the PanPacific although Seattle is very familiar to us-we lived there for 8 yrs. in the 80's. The rooms are well equiped; very clean; beds are beyond comfortable (you don't want to get out of bed); room service, housekeeping, front desk are all very efficient, friendly. You never have to open a door in/out of the hotel-the doormen won't let you. The valet parking is a must whether it be a rental or your own car. You never have to go to the garage ever cause they get it for you and put it away as well no matter how many times you come and go. Starbucks, and all the other shops plus Whole Foods is so convenient!!! When other shops come to the nearby area you won't have to leave there for much. My grown daughter and teenager want to live at the PanPacific! Housekeeping found our wallet and it was mailed back to us at home with everything intact. They have umbrella's for Seattle's raindrops. I am sure that no matter what the request the Pan Pacific staff would do everything within their means to see that you are accomodated. Our coffee maker quit working and they delivered one within minutes late at night. We thought the light bulbs had burnt out so within minutes staff was at the door to help turn on the lights (we didn't know how to flip the switch). Like I say; I've left much out; but you won't regret your stay. If you go to the right site you can get a bang-up deal on the rates. It pays to let your fingers do the tapping. It's home to us; hope it will be for you as well. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chopsar
Reviews.Content: We had a very brief stay at the Pan Pacific, arriving around 10pm and leaving 10am the following morning. Overall the hotel was excellent, with efficient but strikingly courteous and helpful staff. The room was fabulous with panoramic views of Seattle. Bed was very comfortable with quality linen. The bathroom was large with good shower, sumptuous bath and upmarket toiletries.

Reviews.Title: “Everything we expected and more!”
Reviews.Author: MisterManSr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Pan Pacific and we were not disappointed. The staff was exceptional from the time we checked in to the time we checked out. We were always greeted and made to feel at home and they always went out of their way to answer any of our questions. The hotel is meticulously clean and the rooms are no different. Comfy king sized bed and a huge soaking tub. If you're a fan of baths then you'll love this tub. The Vida Spa and hot tub were a great addition. The hotel is in a perfect location because it's close enough to the shops and Pike Place Market yet far enough from everything to feel separated. We will be staying at the Pan Pacific when we visit Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: NCGE
Reviews.Content: Our room was great. Especially the pillows and quilt. Having Whole Foods attached to the hotel is a nice feature if your looking for a light snack or nice bottle of wine to relax in your room with. Hotel staff were great and welcoming. If your walkers the hotel is in a great location for the Seattle Centre and downtown shopping. Felt very save everywhere we went

Reviews.Title: “Best Service I have ever had at a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KristaRolleri
Reviews.Content: Let me preface by saying I got an amazing deal through Travelocity, so I am going by that pricing and not what the hotel charges if you book through them. This was an amazing value for what we paid. The service was TOP NOTCH. They have a car service to take you to and from airport, but unfortunately it does not run on the weekends. We got the best service from Yoshi who was working when we arrived and every night the week we stayed. He even wrote a birthday card for us! Kimberly was phenomonal and ran to the pharmacy for us when my boyfriend had an allergic reaction. She even arranged their towncar to take us to and from hospital. Bed, room, everything else was clean and great and comforable, but the service is really what made this hotel stand apart for me. The only thing is I wish it was closer to walk to Pike place, we walked it a few times, but did cabs as well since it is a 25 min hike. Also, I wish the gym was in the building and not in building across.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: LuigiSydney
Reviews.Content: The PanPacific was absolutely perfect in every way. Hotel itself, the rooms, the location near Whole Foods, the staff, price/value, etc. In particular, the staff was very helpful, one of the best we've ever experienced. We would definiately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience in every way!”
Reviews.Author: owenandlukas
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience staying at the Pan Pacific. I would say the most outstanding aspect of our stay was the service. We have never been in a hotel that was more welcoming, friendlier or more tuned in to our needs. We were greeted each morning of our 7 day stay; we were welcomed home each evening. The hotel is immaculate, lobby and our room. The staff helped us in every way they were able and apologized if we had to wait for even a minute. There is a very friendly bar just off the lobby and the Seastar raw bar and restaurant just a few steps farther. A meal at Seastar was delicious and served impeccably. The location of the hotel was excellent. A bus and trolley stop was down an escalator and, in addition, we could easily walk to the harbor in 15 or 20 minutes. One additional plus was a Whole Foods market also located down that escalator! We would not hesitate to return to Pan Pacific in Seattle or any other of their hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: LeavingVegasBehind
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a full week and were never disappointed. All staff - front desk, front door, cleaning staff were professional and accommodating. We are planning another trip to Seattle in the spring and will stay here again. Loved that it was located on the streetcar line. We used the streetcar a lot. We'd take it to the hub downtown and then walk. We also went to the Lake Union area. Great spot. We ate at the SeaStar restaurant once and really enjoyed it. Whole Foods is located next to the hotel so that was really convenient for snacks, breakfast, etc. Portage Bay cafe down the street was divine! Busy on weekends, but nice and quiet during the week. I highly recommend it. Our room was not huge, but plenty of room. Bathroom was large, nicely laid out and decorated. The armoire allowed plenty of room for clothes and stuff that we bought while shopping. Had as much or more room than a "real" closet.

Reviews.Title: “Sunny in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: kchow20
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice and the rooms are spacious. It took us a while to find the hotel and we circled the block a few times. We rented a car and just parked on the street. Parking is $2.50/hour and Mon-Sat 8:00am to 6:00pm you had to pay. The front desk staff were very nice and friendly. The rooms were very clean and the bathroom was HUGE - shower and bath tub. The hotel had bath gel for bubble baths. The bathroom used a pocket door, so it saved space. Only thing I thought was strange was the placement of the armoire, I felt like every time i went into the room I would run into it. I like they had full length mirrors. The Whole Foods is great for late night snacks or breakfast. The location was pretty good a little further away from Pike Place and Space Needle by walking. All in all the hotel was lovely and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “trendy,botique hotel what a gem!”
Reviews.Author: arpin715
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my two adult chilren-21 and25.Yoshi and the other staff were so friendly and helpful.We walked to the warf alot and it is quite a walk-but also part of the vacation experience for us.We did taxi it a few times-to pioneer square,and it only cost $10.00.We also took the city bus to China town used the tram to go down town.We also checked out Pike Place Market two days in a row!A definite must see.When we shared our travels with the hotel staff they said that we reminded them of all the cool stuff the city has to offer that the locals tend to take for granted.We also rode the Washington State Car Ferry out to Bremmerton.A very inexpensive outing for only $6.00 round trip.The hotel was a welcome end to our busy days!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: HolyMohle
Reviews.Content: Our family ended up a week long Washington State vacation with a stay at the hotel for a Friday and Saturday night. We were able to utilize free street parking most of the weekend and utilize the streetcar that passes in front of the hotel. The coolest part of the stay was that the hotel was on top of a Whole Foods grocery store and there was an awesome view of the Space Needle and Lake Washington from our window. You can walk to the Seattle Center from the hotel but in retrospect we should have taken a taxi at night after our dinner at the Space Needle through the surrounding neighborhood. Room was clean, hotel staff was friendly. Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “All great except room service”
Reviews.Author: DrOfWaves
Reviews.Content: Very nice and clean room. No ice machines so you have to ask room service. I asked them how long it would take and they said 10 minutes. They finally showed over an hour later at an inconvenient time.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel for me in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: threegirlmom
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel I have ever stayed in, and I have stayed in my share of nice hotels. The Pan Pacific has the friendliest and most helpful staff I have ever encountered on my travels. They truly work hard to make your stay the most enjoyable possible. I found myself looking forward to returning to the hotel after a day walking in the city just to be welcomed by the smiling staff. My husband and I were celebrating our 20th anniversary and when we got to our room there was a lovely bottle of wine with cheese and crackers waiting for us. The staff even signed a "happy anniversary" card for us. The room was beautiful, the soaking tub was amazing and everything was top notch. The location was perfect, not too close to the hustle bustle of the city but a very short walk to practically everything. The Whole Foods below the hotel was the icing on the cake. You must try the Creme Brulee French Toast. It is amazing! When you are planning your trip to Seattle, do not even bother looking elsewhere. The Pan Pacific is the hotel you want to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, street noise on lower floors”
Reviews.Author: Elvenfair
Reviews.Content: First of all, "noisy" is a relative term. My only complaint about this hotel was that our room (and I can't remember what floor it was on) had enough street noise to keep me awake. Friends who stayed near the top floor said it wasn't a problem for them. Also, the shape of the room was interesting -- it's a little crowded by the door. But now, the good things! We stayed here on our wedding night, so we took a limo and didn't have to deal with parking. The service was as great as you'd expect in this class of hotel; they went out of their way several times to be nice to us. The room was unique but perfect for a honeymoon, with the large glass shower and roomy soaking tub (both big enough for two! :) ). The bar downstairs was nice, and I liked just sitting in front of the fire in the lobby, too. As one reviewer described it, if you aren't friends with your roommates before your stay, you sure will be after -- the sliding wall lets you remove the separation between the bathroom and bedroom area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel with flawless service.”
Reviews.Author: Smooth_Obturator
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a couple of other Pan Pacific hotels, and while this one may not feel as ritzy it meets all other expectations of a 4 diamond hotel. The service from the moment you arrive to the moment you leave is extremely attentive. The rooms were modern feeling with a great open bathtub that connects to the bedroom. I didn't have time to eat at the adjoining restaurant downstairs, but my friends said that it was pretty good. The only negative comment I can think of is that the hotel is located away from downtown which may be a good thing or a bad thing. Good in that it makes it a quieter more pleasant environment, but bad if you don't like walking.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Mixed, But Mostly Good”
Reviews.Author: HollyH29
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Seattle is quite a beautiful hotel and the level of service was first-rate. The views from the wall of windows were outstanding, and the bathroom is one of the best: the tub is very deep and there is a separate shower room. The location is OK - Whole Foods and Starbucks couldn't be more convenient, but it was maybe a 10 minute walk to the main shopping and 15 minutes to Pike Place. Neighborhood felt safe. Hotel parking is expensive, but that is the case anywhere in Seattle. And their friendly valet service includes in-and-out privileges, which is nice. The main disappointment for us was the condition of the room. While generally clean and stylish, it didn't quite live up to the standard of the rest of the hotel. There were some small stains in the carpet here and there, black smudges on the cabinets, and the loveseat was the most uncomfortable piece of furniture I've encountered in a hotel! The cushion squishes down, leaving your legs hanging over the hard frame in the front. Another disappointment was the minibar policy - even in the Executive Suite there is only an area for about 4 pop cans left for personal use. The rest is electronically monitored, so that if you move one of their bottles, you pay! A note said they will remove all the drinks on request - for a fee of $35! Ridiculous. And finally, the fitness center is located in a separate building across a small courtyard. It's not far at all, but it would be a lot more convenient right inside the hotel. Bottom line: we had a good stay, but there are other hotels in Seattle in the same price range that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pan Pacific Hotel in Seattle”
Reviews.Author: JandBinPHX
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent and we loved the hotel in general. I can see how some might say the living space in the rooms is a bit small, but I think the use of space and pocket door features make it work. The bath room was large and had a nice sized shower and a big tub. We were in town for a wedding and to sight-see so the size of the room was not a major focus. The bed was not very comfortable but it wasn't too bad. The service from the staff was fantastic though and we would stay there again. One thing to be aware of is the cost of parking. $33 per night. Parking in Seattle is expensive anyway though.

Reviews.Title: “Location & Parking”
Reviews.Author: mthoodlarry
Reviews.Content: We are not familiar with downtown Seattle and had difficulty even finding the hotel. To add to the confusion, the entrance/lobby is off street. That space is also shared with several near by businesses.... good luck finding a place to park to even register. This is all topped off with being charged $33.00 to park your car overnight!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'm conflicted about this Pan Pacific Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yvrbs
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel but I was expecting better as I have stayed in Pans around the world including Vancouver, Singapore and Bangkok. It really is more of a boutique hotel and while the premium king room was nice enough, it was still rather average except perhaps for the bathroom which had a great large soaker tub and freestanding shower in it. The traffic noise from a busy bus and emergency vehicle route street is bad if the window is open and barely tolerable with it closed although it was OK for sleeping but starts up again about 6am. Be warned, there is the dreaded "move it and it's yours" bar fridge which is a colossal pain if you want to keep a couple of your own cold drinks in it. They'll empty it out for you for $35-that's really bush league. On the plus side, free internet and newspaper is a nice touch. Service was OK but nothing special for this class of hotel. They did deal swiftly and appropriately with a problem. Only bar is really part of an independently run attached restaurant. The location is a 15 minute walk from downtown in an area that is starting to become trendy called Belltown which is full of 20 and 30 somethings who probably work in high tech (Amazon's new offices are located nearby) and are always talking and texting on their smartphones-even in the checkout line at the attached Whole Foods which I was much more impressed with than the hotel. I have no idea why this hotel is rated as #1 in Seattle. Many reviewers talk about the friendly and courteous staff-but look- for $200+ a night you'd better get a smiling face from all staff. If you are used to the world class standards of a Pan Pacific Hotel, you aren't going to find it in Seattle and quite frankly the Grand Hyatt, Westin and Monaco are 3 hotels in Seattle at about the same price point that I would stay in before I returned here and based on the same ridiculous $33 a night for valet parking that those 3 hotels charge, the Pan Pacific Seattle must think it's in the same class as these 3. It's not.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Kindness”
Reviews.Author: whatever12349
Reviews.Content: I told them before I arrived that it was my girlfriend's birthday and they never stopped going above and beyond to make us welcome. They delivered champagne and birthday card signed by all, upgraded our room to one that overlooked the Sky Needle. The girl behind the reception desk walked out to push the button on the elevator so we didn't have to! Everyone associated with this establishment was more than willing to help. It seemed everyone employed by this hotel was just naturally kind. Our room was spotless and well kept. Beds were outstandingly comfortable. An awesome place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Believe The Hype!!!”
Reviews.Author: Martrese
Reviews.Content: Normally the Pan Pacific is out of my price range, but while researching my husband's and my Seattle birthday getaway, I found a phenomenal deal on Travelzoo and couldn't resist booking the #1-rated hotel on TripAdvisor. Yes, it's as fabulous as everyone says. We were enthusiastically greeted every time we entered and left. Check in and out were seamless. Dinner at the Seastar restaurant was outstanding. Then there's the room. . . Room 714 faces northeast and was a very comfortable size for two people. (We could see the Space Needle if we pressed our faces to the glass and looked left.) The abundance of toiletries was a nice touch - loofah mitt, large tubes of shampoo & conditioner, bath salts for that big tub, etc. Free in-room WiFi is a BIG plus - we hate it when hotels nickel-and-dime you for internet access. We streamed music from on line, though the room is tricked out with every entertainment gadget you could want. LOCATION: Definitely not in the middle of the tourist attractions, but we liked that. A 3/4-mile walk down Lenora will put you directly on an overpass staircase/elevator that leads directly to the waterfront/Alaskan Way tourist attractions. The hotel entrance doesn't face the street and accessing the internal courtyard can be a little tricky the first time. (Enter on Terry Avenue.) 30-minute parking is allowed in the plaza for unloading. We didn't want to pay the steep valet parking fee so we saved $7/day by parking at the Pacific Place mall garage and walking back to the hotel. We used our car for dinner at Canlis on Saturday night and were able to find free on-street parking right outside the hotel when we returned. (Street parking is free after 6pm Saturday and all day Sunday - why pay for a garage?) The hotel is adjacent to the residential tower and the plaza has lots of amenities - Whole Foods, the obligatory Starbucks, dry cleaner, FedEx/Kinkos, card shop, pet store and a few nice restaurants. It felt like home away from home (rather than a tourist mecca). And Jazz Alley, Cinerama and Top Pot Doughnuts are a short walk down Lenora. I didn't use the fitness center (which was probably equally amazing) because we had awesome weather. I ran every day along the waterfront - straight down Lenora to Elliott Bay and north into Elliott Bay Park. There's a time-release water fountain about 1/2 mile in and another at the Fisherman's Pier along with public restrooms. Continue on the paved path past the grain terminal, along the cruise ship pier, follow the train tracks, around the school bus parking lot, and end in cute Smith Cove Park on the water (another time-release water fountain), which is a little over 4.5 miles from the hotel. If you head south, the rest rooms at the Seattle Ferry Terminal may come in handy. ;) HIGHLY RECOMMEND: If you've money to burn, have a phenomenal dinner at Canlis. Not to be believed. We saw the Dave Brubeck quartet at Jazz Alley, a really nice club. Don't miss the Seattle Public Library - it ain't your grandmother's library, funded by Microsoft and a technological wonder. You could easily spend an hour starting on the 10th floor & wandering down to the cafe. Bring your camera. Take a sightseeing boat tour if the weather is nice - it's the best way to see the city from a new perspective (and boat rides are just so darn romantic).

Reviews.Title: “5 Star !”
Reviews.Author: woodsmokeillinois
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, comfortable rooms and very quiet. Never heard any noises in the hall or in other rooms.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service , accomodations and location”
Reviews.Author: curiousqueries
Reviews.Content: The location was incredible, right above the whole foods. There was a free great towncar service which was really handy. Customer service excellent. Friendly helpful staff. Fast and efficient. Beds comfortable. room well designed, very spacious and very luxurious. the bath products were really nice and housekeeping did a great job. Only minor thing was that our phone was not working so well on the last night but when it was working, service was very fast in responding. would definately stay here again. great free internet service and the hotel restaurant was surprisingly really good!

Reviews.Title: “Different Kind of Pan, but New Favorite Seattle Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: RunningWithWolves
Reviews.Content: I booked here because I love the Vancouver BC Pan. I booked a suite room on the Denny street side. When I pulled in via auto, I was initially very conflicted. The entryway was unexpected--it looked small and , well, hmmmm. The place is small-- a boutique hotel. But the Pan spirit was there from entry. Hmmm. I checked in. The staff was excellent on check in. The room was beautiful--simple, elegant, perfect---but oh my gawd the road noise was crazy. And some other noise emanating from the bowels. I couldn't tell from what. I tried to sleep there the first night and just couldn't. I called the desk. They, with grace and style, gave me a choice of a number of other rooms, took me around to view them, and I moved to the courtyard side. Heaven. And I would late find that the location is exceptional. If you're driving, it's right off a major freeway exit. If you're walking downtown to Nordstroms's or elsewhere--enjoy. And the best? Excellent pet store right across the courtyard, exceptional spa, and a WHOLE FOOD STORE and deli just downstairs. So sum: VERY unobtrusive boutique Pan. No flash, no dash, but the longer I was there, the more I realized---this is really it in Seattle. New favorite Seattle hotel. .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, excellent staff, great location...”
Reviews.Author: CaymanTraveller69
Reviews.Content: Didn't need our car. Basically parked the car on Friday and picked it up on Monday when we left. Save yourself the rental and Valet fees. This hotel is a short walk to just about everywhere you want to go. Most enjoyed a very comfortable room with a unique closeable opening to the bath room that made the room feel much larger. Service was top notch, bedding comfortable, even room service impecable all for an excellent price...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous, getaway within the city”
Reviews.Author: cheaptravelbug
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for $150 per night for 2 nights (Got it 4 weeks prior for the discount) What I loved about this hotel was the hotel itself. The room which is practically a luxury suite with a dadami door connecting the bath tub so you can watch the flat screen TV while taking a bubble bath. I requested 2 queen beds and we still had so much space, which is crucial since I get claustrophobic. It IS a bit of a walk from the center of the city, but doable. I think it took me 25 minutes to walk to the center which is really not a deal breaker. AND, its on top of Whole Foods, which might question a few as to why its a big deal. But the fact isn't the market itself, but its the deli, the cafe, and basically your own DIY restaurant. I had fresh soup and croissant for breakfast, and got a pastry to go in my bag for the walk, then when I came back after a modest dinner I got myself a crab cake and coffee. Definitely will return. ***Internet was free at the business center***

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: wendal18
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific Seattle is one of those rare hotels where they focus on service. The friendly and courteous staff went out of their way to make our family feel at home. We were traveling with our two daughters (ages 6 & 9). The hotel is located close to great restaurants (in particular those belonging to Tom Douglas) and shopping (Nordstroms, Old Navy, Macy's, The Westlake Center and Pan Pacific Center). We were able to walk to the Pike Place Market and take a short shuttle ride to the pier where we boarded a ship for a cruise to Alaska. Staff were attentive, friendly and kind. The hotel was immaculate, the staff were knowledgeable and went out of their way to make us feel welcome and comfortable. Rooms were clean, sheets were crisp, bathrooms spacious and well stocked with beautiful product and nice robes. There is a Starbucks connected to the hotel that opens at 5:00 am for those in need of a java 'fix'. There is also a magnificent Whole Foods store below the hotel that has a gourmet selection of prepared food and a great snack bar that serves meals from breakfast through dinner. The selection at Whole Foods was great and appealing to our kids and quick. We were near the Space Needle, Science Center and Experience Music Project. The hotel also made a car and driver (Lincoln Town Car) available to us Monday to Friday to drive us to sights and take my husband to the Ball Game. Our stay was most enjoyable. We will return to the Pan Pacific Seattle and recommend it without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, great location, superb service”
Reviews.Author: Cilantro_and_Lime
Reviews.Content: My family of four and our 19-year-old German friend stayed at the Pan Pacific for three nights in early August. After looking online for the best rates, I called the hotel directly who gave me the same rates I would have had through Expedia, a deal at $235 for two, spacious, Executive King rooms, (814 and 914) with all the bells and whistles. The beds were the most comfortable I've slept on in any hotel. The teenagers who drew the short straws for the pull-out couches said they were good, too. The bathrooms were first-class with separate shower and large soaker tub. I was impressed to see that the coffee supplied in the room was the same rather expensive brand we use at home. My husband and I used the gym facilities which had top-notch equipment. The rooms, lobby and hallways were spotlessly clean. It was the best chain hotel I've stayed at where you get the local feel of the city: the hallways were decorated with historical photos of old Seattle, the Space Needle featured prominently in the view (the hotel is situated to maximize the views for as many rooms as possible), the modernist glass architecture in the hotel and surrounding neighbourhood was typical Seattle, reflecting the subtle Pacific Northwest skies. The view from the courtyard looking towards the Needle is very fine. While we never ate at the hotel restaurant, the large Whole Foods store at the street level was ideal for breakfast and a fast snack. How much more Seattle can you get than drinking fresh, organic carrot juice? The upscale pizza restaurant next door was delicious. The service was attentive and genuinely friendly. The restaurant recommendations were excellent. The hotel surprised us with complimentary appetizers while we were seated at a near-by Italian restaurant. And now to location, which the previous reviewer didn't like. It's just east of the Space Needle and slightly north of downtown, about a 10-minute walk to Nordstrom's. When our bags were too full from a day of shopping the taxi fare back to the hotel was less than 5 bucks, but otherwise we walked. If one were staying in a larger city, such as New York, one wouldn't even notice such a triviality. The hotel felt as if it were in a real cool urban neighbourhood, where people actually lived, but with the benefit of being right next to the downtown core. (Silly, I know, but I could imagine Frasier neurotically pacing behind one of the penthouse windows in the surrounding condos.) We went to several local restaurants, where real Seattle people eat, which were fabulous. And so, unless you have serious mobility issues, don't let the location deter you. And even then, take a cab. The best of all was the service. I'd stupidly left my expensive telephoto lens and camera bag in my room after check-out, which I'd tucked in the night table stand. The hotel kindly shipped it to my home right away. While you're in Seattle, here's a must-see. Be sure to check out the Experience Music Project (EMP), rent the iPods and listen to the guitars in the guitar gallery. Very cool.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel is not in Downtown Seattle, could be anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: MorrisLondon
Reviews.Content: Staying here due to Trip Advisor Reviews. Thought I had booked a Suite with Balcony at $299 per night close to Downtown Seattle. Actually staying in one large clean modern room (525 SqFt?) with Balcony, in what seems like, the middle of knowhere. Car Parking is $33 for 24 Hrs. For $247 per night, you can stay at the Grand Hyatt Downtown in an Executive 2 room Suite (812 SqFt).

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: TNT14
Reviews.Content: Finally writing this review after two weeks back to work. This hotel deserves all the positive reviews it gets and although some kinks may need to be worked out the staff will always be there to take care of anything you need. We were fortunate enough to stay at this great hotel on two occasions during our trip to the Pacific Northwest. The General Manager, David Sullivan, as well as Paul, who will be the first to welcome you, and Angela at the front desk made our trip the most memorable yet. This hotel should be the top on everyone's list when you come to Seattle. First of all, the rooms on both occasions were great. Our first room was Deluxe Double facing the Needle. My two kids refused to close the curtains at night as they fell asleep with a Seattle landmark gleaming in the distance. The bathroom was also great with a nice tub that had doors above that opened up to allow you to bathe and look outside at the great view. My son and daughter took a bath every night during our stay forcing us to go to Lush at Westgate Center to by bubble bath. It was a neat feature to have that I'm sure other hotels in Seattle could not offer. On our second stay in Executive room on view was of Lake Union which was equally beautiful. The bathroom was even bigger, if possible, with a shower you could invite all your friends to. (If you are in to that!) Anyway, both rooms were spectacular. Having a Whole Foods along with two great restaurants, Seastar and Tutto Bella, come in handy after a long day of sightseeing. Also a nice feature at the hotel was the access to the free internet right near the front desk. All these things add up on along vacation and the fact we could get a good affordable meal or save on internet services helped out. These are things the big chains nickel and dime you on. Having stayed at this Pan Pacific and the Pan Pacific Village Centre in Whistler I felt we got more than our monies worth. Finally, As most reviews stated it is a couple of blocks from Westlake Center and shopping, the Space Needle, or a little bit longer to Pike Place Market but what better way to enjoy this beautiful city than to walk it. Public transportation is located steps from the hotel, the hotel has a car service, and taxis await in the parking lot for those who do not wish to take it all in. This should not be a reason to not to stay at this perfect getaway spot. We did it with two kids in the middle of a heat wave. In a very green city everyone should go out there and just walk it, unless it is raining which then the Pan Pacific will gladly give you an umbrella. Thanks to all the staff for your hospitality and we are counting the days until our family can be welcomed home again to the Pan Pacific Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olberto
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife on the first night of our honeymoon, and then again for another night ten days later. I booked it on the strength of it'sTripadvisor rating and as usual I was extremely pleased. From the word go we were absolutely spoilt by this hotel. Within five minutes of walking through the door we were in a suite overlooking the Space Needle with a complimentary bottle of champagne. The staff were superb, the room was beautiful - well designed, spacious, quiet, spotlessly clean and with a very comfy bed. Just to prove that it wasn't a fluke, the reception staff greeted us like old friends when we arrived for our second stay and put us in a suite on the 8th floor. A bottle of wine from the manager arrived soon afterwards. Obviously honeymooners do sometimes get a bit of special treatment but it was the attitude of this hotel which impressed me. Some hotels clearly don't care about their guests, some hotels do a good job of pretending to care about their guests and some hotels genuinely go the extra mile to create a positive experience for their guests. PP Seattle is well and truly in the latter category. In summary, two perfect stays at this superb hotel. I would not hesitate to stay there again. ps. Don't let anyone tell you that this hotel is out of town, it's a maximum 5 minute walk to the main shopping area, maybe 10 to Pike Place Market.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stefana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific on our first trip to Seattle last August. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The room was very clean and comfortable. I loved the bathtub. There are doors that open up so you can look out to the room while you are in the tub. There is a Starbucks and a Whole Foods right by the hotel which were very convenient. The Whole Foods was great. The only thing was I thought the location was a little out of the way. It wasn't horrible though. Everything was still within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if a little remote from downtown”
Reviews.Author: Foxdog
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff and rooms are clean and spacious with full features. Location is in transition (a few uninviting alleys, a strip club down the street, but lots of construction nearby). It's also a long walk from downtown but doable and there is public transportation right behind the hotel. A huge Whole Foods is right under the hotel and an Enterprise car rental one block away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel was spotless”
Reviews.Author: fairchank
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific for two nights before leaving on an Alaska cruise. The hotel was located in a convenient location - you can easily walk to Pike's or the Space Needle within 10 to 15 minutes from the hotel. It is also convenient to any of the downtown area and you walk through some of it on the way down to the Market. The hotel is also situated with a few businesses adjacent to the property which is convenient if you need food, drink, etc. The best is the Whole Foods Market which the hotel sits on top of - I am still going through withdrawals not having one near me in Florida. There is also a Bank of America, Starbucks, drug store, mail/packaging shop all within one minute of the lobby doors. I upgraded the room to the Space Needle KIng room. The room was on a low floor but still had fantastic views of the Needle. There is apparently only one of these rooms per floor - each one on the corner of the building facing the Needle. This gives you an entire side of the room (including bathroom areas) that face the Space Needle. While a higher room would have been nice, the view was still great. Our friends did not have the upgrade and while they could "see" the Needle, it was only by looking out sharply to the left. We, on the other hand, could lay in bed looking out towards it - there was no place in the room you could not see it unless it was foggy. The hotel was immaculately clean - probably one of the best kept properties I've been to including some Ritz's, etc. The bed was amazingly comfortable. Negatives? Yes, a few but they were minor. First, the TV programming is difficult to use and figure out. And checking out online from room proved to be frustrating and impossible. I also had just left the front desk where I made arrangements for a taxi to take us to the cruise terminal and when I got up to the room to checkout, the door keys were deactivated. I went back down, got the keys reactivated and went up to get the bags and checkout. That's when I had the issue with the online checkout. So, upon visiting the desk the third time in a half hour (the same person), he looked at me like he did not recognize me at all. So that was a little odd - but the hotel did allow me to check out a bit later so I was able to overlook this as a minor problem. Would I stay there again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful design and comfort”
Reviews.Author: kcolorado
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel is wonderful. If you appreciate good design, this is the place. It isn't boring or trendy hotel design, just beautifully and thoughtfully designed with every detail carefully thought out. Our room was perfect; spacious, floor to ceiling windows with a view and lovely furniture- even an Aeron chair at the desk. The sheets and the bed are amazing and luxurious- I want to buy some for home . Details matter to me and this hotel does everything well. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast in the bar was delicious thought not cheap. Nearby is a great pizza place and one of the best seafood restaurants in Seattle as well as Whole Foods. I would return in a heartbeat. Yes,parking is pricey and it is a bit of a walk to the tourist sites, though public transportation is right outside the door and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, good location”
Reviews.Author: OlgaandJan
Reviews.Content: Very nice modern stylish 5 star hotel Room very spacious, especially looking to location, almost in downtown Seattle. Only some blocks walking from downtown. Valet parking is same price as self parking, so donot bother. The restaurant in the same building is perfect. The Whole Foods supermarket is wonderful. For us as Europeans this is a hot spot! You can have breakfast, lunch and dinner in this supermarket. It was just a perfect stay for two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service, facilities and location!”
Reviews.Author: Superjungleboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the end of June with a friend, this hotel is wonderful! The gym and spa are beautiful and the rooms are amazing and very clean. Loved the deep soaker tub after a long day of touring Seattle. Staff made an error with a breakfast charge but fixed it immediately. The location is fantastic too, just a few blocks from Seattle center and the space needle and very close to the downtown core. Cant wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing room, great service and location”
Reviews.Author: A5Boyo
Reviews.Content: This may be the finest hotel I've visited (and I've stayed in Four Seasons, Fairmonts, and other 5 star hotels). We booked a basic King room and were upgraded to some sort of nicer King room that had a sofe sleeper and huge floor to ceiling windows along two walls. (Room 314). The design and furnishings of the room exceeded any other big city hotel room I've visited. The hotel can be spendy but if you can get a deal on travelzoo or orbitz, take advantage and go. Even if you can't get a deal, this makes for a nice splurge. We were grateful a hotel of this quality allowed us to visit with our Lab, Daisy. We were with small children and having a huge Whole Foods market on the ground floor made it incredibly convenient (though not cheap) to put together each morning's breakfast or pick up items for the day's adventure. The staff was wonderful and attentive. For example, when our room was cleaned, the attendant lined up all our daughter's toys and dolls and cutely arranged them on her bed. (She loved that). The parking is expensive but that is normal at a big city hotel. The neopolitan pizza at the adjacent Tutta Bella pizzeria was excellent. I would return to this hotel with great anticipation.

Reviews.Title: “Get Room 1010”
Reviews.Author: rjcraddock
Reviews.Content: 1010 is an upgrade, but well worth it. Corner suite with King Bed and windows all along two walls. One window looks out on the Space Needle, the other window looks out on Lake Union. Whole Foods grocery is right outside the hotel and is a great place to eat breakfast or even a casual dinner as the hot food bar is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, not worth the money!!! Stay elsewhere -- Four Seasons was lovely!!!”
Reviews.Author: luxuryoregonmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two awful nights!! The staff is poorly trained and for a relatively new hotel, it is not maintained well. When we arrived in our first room it was not what I had reserved. Informed front desk about this and were asked if I had really reserved an Executive King. I told them that I had the confirmation letter and then they remembered that yes, in fact, I had reserved that type of room, but it wasn't ready. We wasted the first few hours of our trip switching rooms and waiting for our luggage. Was a bottle of wine sent to our room or flowers to compensated for frustration and time wasted? NO!!!. What was sent to our room, which seemed quite shabby compared to the first room that they sent us to, were three -- count them -- 3 different engineers on separate times to fix the TV, a door that wouldn't lock and a smoke alarm that kept going off at 10:00 p.m. and kept my young children awake for 50 minutes. I have one positive thing to say about the hotel and that would be the location. It was quite handy to be next to the Whole Foods, Starbucks, and a great pizza place - Tutto Bella Neopolitano! Other than that don't bother with this hotel. Our last night in town was blissfully spent at the Four Seasons -- the smoke alarm thing did me in -- definitely worth every penny!!

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect in Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: mimason
Reviews.Content: This hotel was practically perfect. It was very modern and extremly clean. The staff was very courteous and professional in every way. My family and I stayed in the executive suite. It was roomy (525 square feet) with a large bathroom and balcony. We had a car so the location was not an issue. The hotel does provide some morning and evening transportation to the tourist attractions. I would like to clear up some things I read in reviews that may help you on your trip. First, the hotel does not have an ice machine but the will gladly send ice complimentary to your room if you ask. I this is an important point, it is amazing what happens if you just ask for something. Also, parking. Yes, if you do park in the garage it is $33.00 a night. But after 6:00 it is free on the street and there is plenty of parking. We went to Seattle to see the sights so we were gone all day and parked on the street at night, no charge. The gym- it is really across a beautiful courtyard not a street and it is not far at all. It is very nice and accessible 24 hours with your room key. The best thing of all is you have access to a whole foods grocery store which has everything you could possible need. I did a lot of reasearch on hotels before I booked this one and I have no regrets. This hotel was perfect, no complaints!

Reviews.Title: “Expectations exceded”
Reviews.Author: GPosner8
Reviews.Content: It is not often that you can expect to encounter excellence in today's world. That expectation was exceded beyond my wildest dreams by my recent stay at the Pan Pacific Hotel in Seattle. From my first contact for reservations to the moment our car left the hotel we were treated to unparalleled service. The hotel is conviently located close to town without giving the feeling that you are in downtown. The dramatic views of the Space Needle and the Olympic mountain range from our hotel window thirlled us each day. Our room was spacious,light and very comfortable. Every possible luxury from free wi-fi to a dvd was at our disposal. The bed, let's face the most important piece of furniture, was large and comfortable. The staff were pleasant,helpful and showed a degree of professionalism not seen today. I honestly believe that the word pampered may be an understatement. The hotel itself is surrounded by shops,restaurants, coffee houses and a day spa complete with gym available to guests. In today's world of hectic pace, surly service and disappointment the Pan Pacific Hotel in Seattle is an oasis of calm, leisure and attentiveness that everyone deserves in their lives.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, can't say enough!”
Reviews.Author: LitPr0f
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad Expedia recommended this hotel as a flight/hotel package! We stayed one night before our Alaska cruise and one night after. The rooms were huge, impeccably clean, and very aesthetically pleasing. The beds were dreamy. The staff were super friendly, polite and helpful. The fitness center was really nice, too--no pool but a huge jacuzzi and lots of high quality machines. There was free internet in the room and a small business center (also free)if you aren't traveling with your computer. And the location couldn't be better--2 restaurants and a Whole Foods right there, a pleasant walk to the Space Needle and Pikes Market, and right at a tram stop for when you can't walk anymore. I can't wait to return to Seattle so I can stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Pan Pacific hotel, Seattle”
Reviews.Author: Criticaltraveler9021
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel with unique rooms-mine had a bathroom open to the rest of the room but which you could close off with Japanese style sliding doors. The service was exceptional; the price reasonable. Most of the reviews mention Whole Foods and Starbucks--but it wasn't clear to me how convenient they actually are. The Whole Foods store is really the basement of the hotel (although you have to go outside and down the stairs or escalator to get in) AND it's one of the largest and nicest Whole Foods I've seen--so you can eat there or buy a wide variety of food to take back to your room. The hotel restaurant is delightful. It is a bit off the beaten track but at the same time is right on the old Union Lake trolley (Seattle now has a new light rail line as well). And it's only about 8 blocks if you want to walk to the convention center or "downtown" more for other tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED our stay at the delightful-in-every-way Pan Pacific Hotel in Seattle!”
Reviews.Author: janet4fred
Reviews.Content: Pan Pacific is an amazing hotel from the moment you enter the front door. We never came into the hotel without someone personally opening the door with a warm greeting towards us...very welcoming! I would classify the lobby as trendy urban chic..beautiful and open and yet incredibly cozy. All hotel staff encountered were highly professional and helpful and pleasant. One thing we really appreciated was that the elevator was very efficient. We never had to wait more than a few seconds for an elevator to be available. Our room was compact and yet very inviting and cozy with many plush amenities. I looked up the brand of bed and it's appropriately called a 'Hypnos Bed'. Indeed, when we slept on this bed, it's like we were hypnotized or something. It is the MOST comfortable bed! I seriously hardly even moved during the night because I was so comfortable and awoke with not a single ache or pain. It is obvious that the sheets, duvet, pillows and towels are of the highest quality. The room had a nice large flatscreen tv and a chic desk and fantastically ergonomic desk chair as well as a sumptuous chaise lounge. Sitting in the chaise afforded a great view of the Space Needle. The bathroom facilitiies truly exceeded our expectations...granite countertops, large glass shower, fancy toilet, large tub, swingout magnifying mirror, hairdryer, superb toiletries...and all this was nestled behind clever sliding 'window doors'. Housekeeping did an adequate job of tidying and refreshing the room daily. Pan Pacific is located in a great spot within walking distance of every major hot spot in town..and there are MANY hot spots to enjoy! The Seaside Restaurant and Hotel Bar were among the best of all we visited while in Seattle. In fact, our server at another restaurant in town actually recommended our hotel restaurant to us..saying the chef was the top seafood chef in the city! Our servers at the Seaside Restaurant and Hotel Bar were sincerely the most genuinely friendly and helpful of all our dining experiences in Seattle. We cannot praise them enough! We will definitely stay at the Pan Pacific again when we return to Seattle..we can't wait!!

Reviews.Title: “Quality/Value Unsurpassed”
Reviews.Author: QuietTravellor
Reviews.Content: After our Alaska cruise, we shuttled down from Vancouver to Seattle for a one day "land" readjustment. I had seen Pan Pacific Seattle was rated Number One and when a rate too good to be true popped up..."Well just....Book 'um Danno!" Wow and wow! If you are looking for a regal stay with understated charm along with elegance...look no further. From the moment Christine greeted us at the check-in...I knew we were in for a special treat. Our room was sumptous and the marble tiled bathroom with super shower and bathtub were befitting the queen. And, the bed was "blessed" by the queen....and with good reason. We were up on the ninth floor and had great views..including a sliver of the Seattle needle. Everything about our room bespoke understated elegance. And, this was not even one of their larger rooms. Then, to have Whole Foods literally on the premises is a super plus. Can't say enough about all of the staff and their great disposition. If I were running one of the finest hotels in the world....I would train the staff on the example set by the folks at Pan Pacific Seattle. If you seek top quality with top value....you will not be disappointed. Simpy the best!

Reviews.Title: “amazing esp for the low rate of $129”
Reviews.Author: johnnietravels
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I ever stay in a hotel of this type, just for a night I found a last minute special. I did find the front desk staff a bit uninterested in assisting me, but the porters and others at the hotel were amazing. The room was simply a small piece of heaven. It was very ultra modern with every comfort one could want. The bathroom had a door toward the bedroom so I could lay in the tub and watch tv. The hotel was also very quiet, appeared to be quite sound resistent .... I awoke feeling fresh and ready to purpose my other travel adventures...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, clean, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: wanderlustfultexan
Reviews.Content: Seattle Pan Pacific is one of the nicest places I've stayed. It has a very warm, modern look. The service is exceptional, to say the least. We arrived in the wee hours of the morning; the desk clerk, Yoshi , was expecting us. We were addressed by name most of the time by others in the hotel, always by Yoshi. Nothing we requested took more than 5 minutes to procure, including a taxi. The location is right on the South Lake Union Streetcar line, which is helpful, but doesn't get you all the way down to the waterfront. We are big walkers, so this was not a problem for us, but could be an issue if you have mobility limitations. Overall, a fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view and service”
Reviews.Author: oregonchik
Reviews.Content: We went up for a weekend vacation and were very happy with both the service and the hotel itself. Great people and, our room at least, had a great view. Stay here, you'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with superb service”
Reviews.Author: SoonerVacationer
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough about the hotel and their staff. Very professional and helpful. The room was spacious which was a big problem with other hotels our friends stayed at. We had a great view of the city, utilized the market below the hotel and we walked everywhere. Some people complained about the location but we had no trouble getting around with the bus trolley and mostly walking. I booked through Expedia and got an excellent rate. We will return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “More like an apartment than a hotel - great feel”
Reviews.Author: miguelalllen
Reviews.Content: The Pan Pacific in Seattle is a top notch hotel, staff couldn't have been friendlier and the location has more of a residential feel, than a hotel feel. There is a residential building within the complex, along with a Starbucks and Whole Foods, which was very convenient for grabbing a low cost bite. Fitness center is within the complex, just across the parking lot and VERY nice. Also access to the streetcar is right there and walking distance for the more adventurous, doable. IIf you're looking for tours, "Let's Tour Seattle" is a fantastic one, ask for Charles, he's outstanding and takes you off the beaten path a bit, which was great - also "Savor Seattle" food tour of Pike Place Market, terrific look @ things in the market, nice staff to work with as well. The Pan Pacific is a great choice if you're in Seattle and want to be within walking distance to the tourist stuff, yet away from it a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with annoyances”
Reviews.Author: Hawkfan22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for four days in April. The rooms are very comfortable and the service is generally quite good. For us, with a small child, it is very nice having a whole foods below the hotel for quick easy meals. The presence of whole foods is probably 80% of why we have stayed there twice. Staying there you must look past a number of annoyances though. Parking - way too expensive for this part of town $33 a day is simply stupid, there is a way around it if you are willing to move your a car twice a day Tipping - staff continually has a hand out for you to place $$ in, gets to be a bit much after a while Amenities - or lack there of...no pool, no exercise room, no hot tub, vending machines, no ice machine Room - unless you have a suite your seating will consist of one solitary office style chair...and the bed, this can make things difficult if you have four or more of you in the room or if you decide to try to eat in your room Valet Bar - the in room bar fridge charges electronically so if you take anything out you get charged, also we found that if you tip a bottle over a bit to fit in a baby bottle you will also get charged...they took our charges off after two discussions with employees Location - four blocks to anything your interested in...this is quite fine if you are used to walking places, but it is certainly not in the middle of things. Overall, this is a good hotel but you have to be prepared to deal with the annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kolvard
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an Alaska cruise and decided to spend a few days in Seattle. We booked the Pan Pacific and could not have been more pleased. The room had an Asian flair. The bed was so comfy. Had a great lake view. Got invited by management to film festival private party. Hotel has towncar on week days to take you to close destinations. Trolley takes you to lake destinations-bus to wharf. Both are right in front of hotel. Whole foods downstairs covers incidental needs and Starbucks is next door. Also one of best restaurants we ate at is right next door.

Reviews.Title: “Access”
Reviews.Author: excmdr
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Pan Pacific was very nice. The staff were friendly and always accommodating. The health club has real equipment, although no free weights. The best thing about the Pan Pacific is the location. You can take the Bus # 194 from SEA Tac to the Convention Station and walk 6 blocks to the hotel. Want quick meals, there is a Whole Foods just steps away for everything, Starbucks and a B of A next door. Toby, San Jose

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, European and good service”
Reviews.Author: AnotherHoustonian
Reviews.Content: Pros: Incredibly friendly nice staff. Neat, modern styling. Trendy, stylish vibe. High end amenenties. Mattress is wonderful, high thread count sheets. Fluffy towels, bathrobes, etc. Free, reliable wii fii. Definitely a luxurious feel to the the property. Great for romantic weekends. We ate at the restaurant and thought it was fabulous. Cons: Very small rooms, with very little privacy in the bathroom. This place was great with my husband, but I'm not sure it would be as great with my husband and his kides. The soaking tub is one of those things that looks cool, but sort of pointless. I would have preferred having the additional space in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: manictease
Reviews.Content: At first arriving to the hotel, the doormen were helpful and welcoming. The front desk staff were friendly and checked us in efficiently. They offered assistance and recommendations for our stay without being too talkie. The location itself was not the most ideal but it was conveniently midway between the Space Needle atractions and the downtown area. I like to walk and was able to walk to most of the attractions nearby. The room was clean, stylish, and very comfortable. We had cocktails in The Bar and the service was attentive and friendly and the drinks made as we requested (Cosmos, more sour than sweet). There was a tv showing the baseball game and the volume was low-key and not intrusive. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, not so good location”
Reviews.Author: Marce_LCh
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice, comfortable hotel. The staff in unbelievably helpfull and nice. The bathroom is big and has sliding doors so you can soak in the tub and have a great view. Fabulous bed and big TV. The hotel has an adjecent plaza with a Starbucks, spa, Whole Foods and restaurants. If you don't plan to walk around it's the perfect choice. But if you want to walk to the Pike Place Market or go shopping it is not the best location. ps. The hotel is less than 5 min. walk to Rei!

Reviews.Title: “Great newer hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: gr1069
Reviews.Content: I purchased the room through one of the discount travel websites. Two weeks ago I stayed in a Ritz-Carlton and didn't receive anywhere near the level of service we received here. The check in staff was very helpful, offered us everything we could have asked for and more. We stayed in preparation for a cruise and were pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Very special hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariedda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Very chic, beautiful hotel. It could be consider a boutique hotel but its bigger. Great service, pretty lobby, nice bar and outstanding restaurant. The room was a little small but with very exclusive bedding and nice view of the Space Needle. The location is in Downtown but a little bit away from the Pike Place Market, you could walk but it would take you al least 20 min. $10 taxi and free bus...if you are going out to dinner...We had a special, it was a good price for a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect !!”
Reviews.Author: Luvs2cruise45
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms, one night for me and the weekend for my son and his wife at the Pan Pacific in Seattle to celebrate his graduation from Law School. From the moment the attendant took my car every phase of our stay was perfect. The room was beautiful, peaceful and immaculate. Even the tiniest detail was handled promptly. I plan to stay with them again and will highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to see Seattle”
Reviews.Author: gos37389
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Staff made great dinner suggestions throughout our stay. The location of the hotel is within walking distance of downtown Seattle, or a short (cheap) cab ride to further destinations. I will stay here again if I ever come back to Seattle.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: zivago_dc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pan Pacific Seattle from May 14th through May 19th 2009. The hotel is clean and well located in the edge of the downtown business district. Parking can be expensive at a bit more than $30 per night. We booked a 'suite'. While our room was nice, clean and generally pleasant it was not a suite. See photos for details; they show the entire room. The staff makes this hotel a very pleasant stay. It's also nice that there is a Whole Foods and Starbucks below the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen1819
Reviews.Content: Perfect hotel in my book. Front desk staff was attentive, courteous and professional. Room was outstanding - clean, nicely furnished and spacious. Bathroom was perfect with the rainfall shower and a deep soaking tub. Amenities: Coffee making facilities, steamer to press your clothes, big screen television, minibar, hairdryer and free Internet access for your laptop. I was able to print my boarding passes downstairs in the business center. The hotel is about a 7-10 minute walk to the downtown area. The walk is not bad. I found the neighborhood extremely quiet. There is a Starbucks next to the restaurant and a Whole Foods one level below the hotel. The Whole Foods opens at 7 a.m. so you can buy breakfast or snacks for the day. I took the Airporter bus from Sea-Tac Airport. The cost is $18 round trip and you can get off at the Westin which is just a couple of blocks up from the hotel. For a nice day, head on down to Pier 52 and take the ferry to Bainbridge Island. The round trip cost is $6.70. Once you get off the ferry, walk to the right up the street, and then make a left to the shops and restaurants. You will see the signs to show the way. The island is lovely and the shops are quaint. Great place to have lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect - a very enjoyable visit.”
Reviews.Author: happyguestVancouver
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Pan Pacific in Seattle. The service, my room, hotel location and amenities were all exceptional. Everyone from the bellman to the front desk staff were prompt, courteous, pleasant all of the time. The front desk staff always greeted me by name whenever we had a conversation. The room was splendid ... the furniture and decor was very pleasing, all in earth tones and clean lines. The bed, bed linens and pillows were extremely comfortable. The bathroom had a deep soaker tub, rain shower enclosure, large mirror, hairdryer and clothing steamer ... I enjoyed them all very much. The location was very good for me ... it was a short distance to both the Seattle Exhibition Center and downtown shopping. There is also a Starbucks and Wholefoods store in the complex which came in very handy for buying coffee, snacks and quick meals. I had a meal at the hotel restaurant which I enjoyed very much. The service was also very good. The hotel also has a very nice 24/7 fitness center with a whirlpool and steam sauna (used both). There is also a lovely spa in the same complex which I would also recommend. The one surprise at the hotel was the cost of valet parking ($33/night) however, when I did some inquiries, it seemed to be the going rate for other parking lots in the same area. That's the price for staying downtown Seattle. Overall, it was a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a second look”
Reviews.Author: GlobalGirl06
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Pan Pacific, and the hotel was definitely worth the second look. This time, I had more of an opportunity to explore the hotel and environs, and this is really a good choice in Seattle. First, the hotel rooms are cleverly designed, quite comfortable, with beautiful and pristine bathrooms. I had a corner suite looking toward the Space Needle, and the view was great. Last time I only saw the street and an old building, so this view was much better (and I actually paid less this time and was upgraded). The bed is incredibly comfortable, although the room would have benefitted from a good easy chair. The desk chair was very good, but the other chair was more decorative than inviting. The gym is awesome! If you like to work out, you won't want to leave the gym. It's not huge, but larger than most hotel gyms and the equipment is state-of-the-art. I felt like I got as good a workout as I do at home, and you can't get that at most hotel gyms (and it's free!). It, too, was spotless and open 24-7. It's about a 7-10 minute walk to the central city/Pike Place Market, but not bad and safe. There is also a tram if you don't mind paying $1.75 to ride a few blocks. Right at the hotel is a terrific Whole Foods and Starbucks can be accessed from the lobby (it's a real Starbucks, not the hotel kind). If you want to get out of town for the day, there is an Enterprise Car Rental office just a block from the hotel. My only complaints about the room were that the sink doesn't drain (happened on both visits - it's a design flaw) and at night all the tv/dvr/dvd equipment and fridge make noise and there are some lights that kind of blink on and off. Also, the clock by the bed is a retro tick-tock clock, not a digital clock like you usually see in hotels. It was cute but a little loud - I stashed it in the closet. The staff was ok - not overly warm and welcoming, although the doormen seemed nice. None of these little problems would stop me from going back. In fact, it was hard to leave the great room and view behind.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: xsaralynnx
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first anniversary and it was one of the best hotels we have stayed at next to the Four Seasons. The price was great and the Starbucks and Whole Foods being so close was very convenient. We used the city bus stop out front a couple of times. The huge soaking tubs were great too. The staff was very friendly and this is the only place we will stay when visiting Seattle again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Beautiful with great views!”
Reviews.Author: superxfans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 2 nights after returning from the San Juan Islands before flying home. What a great hotel! The rooms are contemporary and absolutely beautiful! We had a room with a great view of the lake! The hotel even has a Whole Foods in the lower level, which was great to run down and grab a snack! I would definitely return to the hotel if in Seattle again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: susielim
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Clean, and well maintained. Gym access is great. Definitely recommended. Get some cheese and wine from Whole Foods across the way. Just don't taste it via a salad dressing cup!

Reviews.Title: “You will Never want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: Carla068
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while touring Seattle. It was one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. The rooms were great and so clean. We would love to go back. It's definitely in our top ten.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Montana_9
Reviews.Content: My visit to Seattle was to attend a 4 day class (8a - 6p). If it hadn't been for the comfort of the room (especially the bed), the wonderful food/food service, and friendliness of staff I don't think I would of survived. The desk and desk chair were ergonomic. And, the proximity of the Vida Spa (right across the parking lot) really turned a stressful week into an enjoyable vacation. They are VERY environmentally friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful Service Over The Phone”
Reviews.Author: MarriedMan2009
Reviews.Content: I have just made my reservations for this hotel for next month, and have not yet stayed here. But I felt compelled to write a review after my experience in booking my reservation. To make a long story short, I had just missed an online deal with low rates for their Suites. I called the hotel and spoke with Adriel V. who was extremely helpful and allowed me to book at the rate that I had missed online. If all the staff is as friendly and helpful as she, I am sure I will enjoy staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Always welcoming and nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: moremelatonin
Reviews.Content: The staff at reception were welcoming, and had allocated me a corner king suite which had a beautiful view of the space needle and views to Lake Washington. I have stayed in a Pan Pacific in Singapore, and the room was of a similar impeccable standard. It was comfortable to work in with an excellent Herman Miller chair. There had been a delay with my luggage and it would be arriving on a later flight. When I returned after a trip into town the bags had been brought to my room. An international fax was sent from reception immediately for business and there was no additional charge. The Whole Foods market was quite unlike anything I had sampled before, and the choice of food was varied and freshly cooked. I ate lunch in the Hotel Restaurant once and the food was also excellent and fresh. Yes, it is located a few blocks from the city center, however this was a welcome 5-10 minute stroll and was safe.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be better!!”
Reviews.Author: Cattledogs
Reviews.Content: The service was SUPERB and the room was large and beautiful. Although it is not right in the middle of attractions, you can walk just about to everything and you do not have to be in the very touristy area. Whole Foods is right next to the hotel and there is the nice pet goods store to purchase souvenier to our dogs in the same complex. REI store is also within the walking distance. One of the best hotels that I have ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “It's hard to find customer service this good!”
Reviews.Author: TravellerLisa
Reviews.Content: We were forced to change our business trip. Ryan and his supervisor were unbelievably understanding and accommodating. We haven't actually stayed at the hotel, yet, but that kind of personal service will keep me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “First Class at lower rate”
Reviews.Author: missyinspokane
Reviews.Content: I spent my 30th birthday at the Pan Pacific Hotel and I'm glad I did. The hotel was very chic and comfortable. The staff was great and when they found out it was my birthday, the staff sent up a personalized birthday card with all the employees' signatures and a bottle of wine. The location next to Whole Foods Market was great. Of all the hotels I've stayed at in Seattle, this would be my first choice without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Valentines Getaway”
Reviews.Author: naytch
